category_name.caption: Category
category_name.description: The event category name, as defined by category_uid value: Application Activity.

category_uid.caption: Category ID
category_uid.description: The category unique identifier of the event.

6.caption: Application Activity
6.description: Application Activity events report detailed information about the behavior of applications and services.

class_name.caption: Class
class_name.description: The event class name, as defined by class_uid value: Application Lifecycle.

class_uid.caption: Class ID
class_uid.description: The unique identifier of a class. A class describes the attributes available in an event.

6002.caption: Application Lifecycle
6002.description: Application Lifecycle events report installation, removal, start, stop of an application or service.

cloud.caption: Cloud
cloud.description: Describes details about the Cloud environment where the event was originally created or logged.

count.caption: Count
count.description: The number of times that events in the same logical group occurred during the event Start Time to End Time period.

device.caption: Device
device.description: An addressable device, computer system or host.

duration.caption: Duration Milliseconds
duration.description: The event duration or aggregate time, the amount of time the event covers from start_time to end_time in milliseconds.

end_time.caption: End Time
end_time.description: The end time of a time period, or the time of the most recent event included in the aggregate event.

end_time_dt.caption: End Time
end_time_dt.description: The end time of a time period, or the time of the most recent event included in the aggregate event.

enrichments.caption: Enrichments
enrichments.description:
The additional information from an external data source, which is associated with the event or a finding. For example add location information for the IP address in the DNS answers:

[{"name": "answers.ip", "value": "92.24.47.250", "type": "location", "data": {"city": "Socotra", "continent": "Asia", "coordinates": [-25.4153, 17.0743], "country": "YE", "desc": "Yemen"}}]

message.caption: Message
message.description: The description of the event/finding, as defined by the source.

metadata.caption: Metadata
metadata.description: The metadata associated with the event or a finding.

observables.caption: Observables
observables.description: The observables associated with the event or a finding.

osint.caption: OSINT
osint.description: The OSINT (Open Source Intelligence) object contains details related to an indicator such as the indicator itself, related indicators, geolocation, registrar information, subdomains, analyst commentary, and other contextual information. This information can be used to further enrich a detection or finding by providing decisioning support to other analysts and engineers.

raw_data.caption: Raw Data
raw_data.description: The raw event/finding data as received from the source.

severity.caption: Severity
severity.description: The event/finding severity, normalized to the caption of the severity_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the source.

severity_id.caption: Severity ID
severity_id.description:
The normalized identifier of the event/finding severity.

The normalized severity is a measurement the effort and expense required to manage and resolve an event or incident. Smaller numerical values represent lower impact events, and larger numerical values represent higher impact events.

1.caption: Informational
1.description: Informational message. No action required.

2.caption: Low
2.description: The user decides if action is needed.

3.caption: Medium
3.description: Action is required but the situation is not serious at this time.

5.caption: Critical
5.description: Action is required immediately and the scope is broad.

6.caption: Fatal
6.description: An error occurred but it is too late to take remedial action.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The event/finding severity is not mapped. See the severity attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

start_time.caption: Start Time
start_time.description: The start time of a time period, or the time of the least recent event included in the aggregate event.

start_time_dt.caption: Start Time
start_time_dt.description: The start time of a time period, or the time of the least recent event included in the aggregate event.

status.caption: Status
status.description: The event status, normalized to the caption of the status_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

status_code.caption: Status Code
status_code.description:
The event status code, as reported by the event source.

For example, in a Windows Failed Authentication event, this would be the value of 'Failure Code', e.g. 0x18.

status_detail.caption: Status Detail
status_detail.description: The status detail contains additional information about the event/finding outcome.

status_id.caption: Status ID
status_id.description: The normalized identifier of the event status.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The event status is not mapped. See the status attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

time.caption: Event Time
time.description: The normalized event occurrence time or the finding creation time.

time_dt.caption: Event Time
time_dt.description: The normalized event occurrence time or the finding creation time.

timezone_offset.caption: Timezone Offset
timezone_offset.description: The number of minutes that the reported event time is ahead or behind UTC, in the range -1,080 to +1,080.

type_name.caption: Type Name
type_name.description: The event/finding type name, as defined by the type_uid.

type_uid.caption: Type ID
type_uid.description: The event/finding type ID. It identifies the event's semantics and structure. The value is calculated by the logging system as: class_uid * 100 + activity_id.

unmapped.caption: Unmapped Data
unmapped.description: The attributes that are not mapped to the event schema. The names and values of those attributes are specific to the event source.

3.description: Identity & Access Management (IAM) events relate to the supervision of the system's authentication and access control model. Examples of such events are the success or failure of authentication, granting of authority, password change, entity change, privileged use etc.

certificate.caption: Certificate

http_request.caption: HTTP Request
http_request.description: Details about the underlying HTTP request.

is_cleartext.caption: Cleartext Credentials
is_cleartext.description:
Indicates whether the credentials were passed in clear text.

Note: True if the credentials were passed in a clear text protocol such as FTP or TELNET, or if Windows detected that a user's logon password was passed to the authentication package in clear text.

is_mfa.caption: Multi Factor Authentication
is_mfa.description: Indicates whether Multi Factor Authentication was used during authentication.

is_new_logon.caption: New Logon
is_new_logon.description: Indicates logon is from a device not seen before or a first time account logon.

is_remote.caption: Remote
is_remote.description: The attempted authentication is over a remote connection.

logon_process.caption: Logon Process
logon_process.description: The trusted process that validated the authentication credentials.

logon_type.caption: Logon Type
logon_type.description: The logon type, normalized to the caption of the logon_type_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

1.caption: System
1.description: Used only by the System account, for example at system startup.

10.caption: Remote Interactive
10.description: A remote logon using Terminal Services or remote desktop application.

11.caption: Cached Interactive
11.description: A user logged on to this device with network credentials that were stored locally on the device and the domain controller was not contacted to verify the credentials.

12.caption: Cached Remote Interactive
12.description: Same as Remote Interactive. This is used for internal auditing.

13.caption: Cached Unlock
13.description: Workstation logon.

2.caption: Interactive
2.description: A local logon to device console.

3.caption: Network
3.description: A user or device logged onto this device from the network.

4.caption: Batch
4.description: A batch server logon, where processes may be executing on behalf of a user without their direct intervention.

5.caption: OS Service
5.description: A logon by a service or daemon that was started by the OS.

7.caption: Unlock
7.description: A user unlocked the device.

8.caption: Network Cleartext
8.description: A user logged on to this device from the network. The user's password in the authentication package was not hashed.

9.caption: New Credentials
9.description: A caller cloned its current token and specified new credentials for outbound connections. The new logon session has the same local identity, but uses different credentials for other network connections.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The logon type is not mapped. See the logon_type attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

status_detail.caption: Status Detail
status_detail.description:
The details about the authentication request. For example, possible details for Windows logon or logoff events are:
  • Success
    • LOGOFF_USER_INITIATED
    • LOGOFF_OTHER
  • Failure
    • USER_DOES_NOT_EXIST
    • INVALID_CREDENTIALS
    • ACCOUNT_DISABLED
    • ACCOUNT_LOCKED_OUT
    • PASSWORD_EXPIRED

The normalized severity is a measurement the effort and expense required to manage and resolve an event or incident. Smaller numerical values represent lower impact events, and larger numerical values represent higher impact events.

action_id.caption: Action ID
action_id.description: The action taken by a control or other policy-based system leading to an outcome or disposition. Dispositions conform to an action of 1 'Allowed' or 2 'Denied' in most cases. Note that 99 'Other' is not an option. No action would equate to 1 'Allowed'. An unknown action may still correspond to a known disposition. Refer to disposition_id for the outcome of the action.

0.caption: Unknown
0.description: The action was unknown. The disposition_id attribute may still be set to a non-unknown value, for example 'Count', 'Uncorrected', 'Isolated', 'Quarantined' or 'Exonerated'.

1.caption: Allowed
1.description: The activity was allowed. The disposition_id attribute should be set to a value that conforms to this action, for example 'Allowed', 'Approved', 'Delayed', 'No Action', 'Count' etc.

2.caption: Denied
2.description: The attempted activity was denied. The disposition_id attribute should be set to a value that conforms to this action, for example 'Blocked', 'Rejected', 'Quarantined', 'Isolated', 'Dropped', 'Access Revoked, etc.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The action was not mapped. See the action attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

activity_id.caption: Activity ID
activity_id.description: The normalized identifier of the Data Security Finding activity.

1.caption: Create
1.description: A new Data Security finding is created.

2.caption: Update
2.description: An existing Data Security finding is updated with more information.

3.caption: Close
3.description: An existing Data Security finding is closed, this can be due to any resolution (e.g., True Positive, False Positive, etc.).

4.caption: Suppressed
4.description: An existing Data Security finding is suppressed due to inaccurate detection techniques or a known true negative.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The event activity is not mapped. See the activity_name attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

activity_name.caption: Activity
activity_name.description: The Data Security finding activity name, as defined by the activity_id.

actor.caption: Actor
actor.description: Describes details about the actor implicated in the data security finding. Either an actor that owns a particular digital file or information store, or an actor which accessed classified or sensitive data.

api.caption: API Details
api.description: Describes details about a typical API (Application Programming Interface) call.

attacks.caption: MITRE ATT&CK Details
attacks.description: An array of MITRE ATT&CK objects describing the tactics, techniques & sub-techniques identified by a security control or finding.

authorizations.caption: Authorization Information
authorizations.description: Provides details about an authorization, such as authorization outcome, and any associated policies related to the activity/event.

category_name.caption: Category
category_name.description: The event category name, as defined by category_uid value: Findings.

category_uid.caption: Category ID
category_uid.description: The category unique identifier of the event.

2.caption: Findings
2.description: Findings events report findings, detections, and possible resolutions of malware, anomalies, or other actions performed by security products.

class_name.caption: Class
class_name.description: The event class name, as defined by class_uid value: Data Security Finding.

class_uid.caption: Class ID
class_uid.description: The unique identifier of a class. A class describes the attributes available in an event.

2006.caption: Data Security Finding
2006.description: A Data Security Finding describes detections or alerts generated by various data security products such as Data Loss Prevention (DLP), Data Classification, Secrets Management, Digital Rights Management (DRM), Data Security Posture Management (DSPM), and similar tools. These detections or alerts can be created using fingerprinting, statistical analysis, machine learning or other methodologies. The finding describes the actors and endpoints who accessed or own the sensitive data, as well as the resources which store the sensitive data.

cloud.caption: Cloud
cloud.description: Describes details about the Cloud environment where the event was originally created or logged.

comment.caption: Comment
comment.description: A user provided comment about the finding.

confidence.caption: Confidence
confidence.description: The confidence, normalized to the caption of the confidence_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

confidence_id.caption: Confidence Id
confidence_id.description: The normalized confidence refers to the accuracy of the rule that created the finding. A rule with a low confidence means that the finding scope is wide and may create finding reports that may not be malicious in nature.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The confidence is not mapped to the defined enum values. See the confidence attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

confidence_score.caption: Confidence Score
confidence_score.description: The confidence score as reported by the event source.

count.caption: Count
count.description: The number of times that events in the same logical group occurred during the event Start Time to End Time period.

data_security.caption: Data Security
data_security.description: The Data Security object describes the characteristics, techniques and content of a Data Loss Prevention (DLP), Data Loss Detection (DLD), Data Classification, or similar tools' finding, alert, or detection mechanism(s).

database.caption: Database
database.description: Describes the database where classified or sensitive data is stored in, or was accessed from. Databases are typically datastore services that contain an organized collection of structured and/or semi-structured data.

databucket.caption: Databucket
databucket.description: Describes the databucket where classified or sensitive data is stored in, or was accessed from. The data bucket object is a basic container that holds data, typically organized through the use of data partitions.

device.caption: Device
device.description: Describes the device where classified or sensitive data is stored in, or was accessed from.

disposition.caption: Disposition
disposition.description: The disposition name, normalized to the caption of the disposition_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

disposition_id.caption: Disposition ID
disposition_id.description: Describes the outcome or action taken by a security control, such as access control checks, malware detections or various types of policy violations.

1.caption: Allowed
1.description: Granted access or allowed the action to the protected resource.

10.caption: Exonerated
10.description: A suspicious or risky entity was deemed to no longer be suspicious (re-scored).

11.caption: Corrected
11.description: A corrupt file or configuration was corrected.

12.caption: Partially Corrected
12.description: A corrupt file or configuration was partially corrected.

13.caption: Uncorrected
13.description: A corrupt file or configuration was not corrected.

14.caption: Delayed
14.description: An operation was delayed, for example if a restart was required to finish the operation.

15.caption: Detected
15.description: Suspicious activity or a policy violation was detected without further action.

16.caption: No Action
16.description: The outcome of an operation had no action taken.

17.caption: Logged
17.description: The operation or action was logged without further action.

18.caption: Tagged
18.description: A file or other entity was marked with extended attributes.

19.caption: Alert
19.description: The request or activity was detected as a threat and resulted in a notification but request was not blocked.

2.caption: Blocked
2.description: Denied access or blocked the action to the protected resource.

20.caption: Count
20.description: Counted the request or activity but did not determine whether to allow it or block it.

21.caption: Reset
21.description: The request was detected as a threat and resulted in the connection being reset.

22.caption: Captcha
22.description: Required the end user to solve a CAPTCHA puzzle to prove that a human being is sending the request.

23.caption: Challenge
23.description: Ran a silent challenge that required the client session to verify that it's a browser, and not a bot.

24.caption: Access Revoked
24.description: The requestor's access has been revoked due to security policy enforcements. Note: use the Host profile if the User or Actor requestor is not present in the event class.

25.caption: Rejected
25.description: A request or submission was rejected. For example, when a form was improperly filled out and submitted. This is distinct from 2 'Blocked'.

26.caption: Unauthorized
26.description: An attempt to access a resource was denied due to an authorization check that failed. This is a more specific disposition than 2 'Blocked' and can be complemented with the authorizations attribute for more detail.

27.caption: Error
27.description: An error occurred during the processing of the activity or request. Use the message attribute of the base class for details.

3.caption: Quarantined
3.description: A suspicious file or other content was moved to a benign location.

4.caption: Isolated
4.description: A session was isolated on the network or within a browser.

5.caption: Deleted
5.description: A file or other content was deleted.

6.caption: Dropped
6.description: The request was detected as a threat and resulted in the connection being dropped.

7.caption: Custom Action
7.description: A custom action was executed such as running of a command script. Use the message attribute of the base class for details.

8.caption: Approved
8.description: A request or submission was approved. For example, when a form was properly filled out and submitted. This is distinct from 1 'Allowed'.

9.caption: Restored
9.description: A quarantined file or other content was restored to its original location.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The disposition is not mapped. See the disposition attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

dst_endpoint.caption: Destination Endpoint
dst_endpoint.description: Describes the endpoint where classified or sensitive data is stored in, or was accessed from.

duration.description: The event duration or aggregate time, the amount of time the event covers from start_time to end_time in milliseconds.

end_time.description: The time of the most recent event included in the finding.

start_time_dt.description: The time of the least recent event included in the finding.

status.caption: Status
status.description: The normalized status of the Finding set by the consumer normalized to the caption of the status_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the source.

status_code.caption: Status Code
status_code.description:
The event status code, as reported by the event source.

For example, in a Windows Failed Authentication event, this would be the value of 'Failure Code', e.g. 0x18.

status_detail.caption: Status Detail
status_detail.description: The status detail contains additional information about the event/finding outcome.

status_id.caption: Status ID
status_id.description: The normalized status identifier of the Finding, set by the consumer.

1.caption: New
1.description: The Finding is new and yet to be reviewed.

2.caption: In Progress
2.description: The Finding is under review.

3.caption: Suppressed
3.description: The Finding was reviewed, determined to be benign or a false positive and is now suppressed.

4.caption: Resolved
4.description: The Finding was reviewed, remediated and is now considered resolved.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The event status is not mapped. See the status attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

table.caption: Table
table.description: Describes the table where classified or sensitive data is stored in, or was accessed from. The table object represents a table within a structured relational database, warehouse, lake, or similar.

time.caption: Event Time
time.description: The normalized event occurrence time or the finding creation time.

time_dt.caption: Event Time
time_dt.description: The normalized event occurrence time or the finding creation time.

timezone_offset.caption: Timezone Offset
timezone_offset.description: The number of minutes that the reported event time is ahead or behind UTC, in the range -1,080 to +1,080.

type_name.caption: Type Name
type_name.description: The event/finding type name, as defined by the type_uid.

type_uid.caption: Type ID
type_uid.description: The event/finding type ID. It identifies the event's semantics and structure. The value is calculated by the logging system as: class_uid * 100 + activity_id.

200601.caption: Data Security Finding: Create
200601.description: A new Data Security finding is created.

200602.caption: Data Security Finding: Update
200602.description: An existing Data Security finding is updated with more information.

200603.caption: Data Security Finding: Close
200603.description: An existing Data Security finding is closed, this can be due to any resolution (e.g., True Positive, False Positive, etc.).

200604.caption: Data Security Finding: Suppressed
200604.description: An existing Data Security finding is suppressed due to inaccurate detection techniques or a known true negative.

unmapped.caption: Unmapped Data
unmapped.description: The attributes that are not mapped to the event schema. The names and values of those attributes are specific to the event source.

data_security_finding.caption: Data Security Finding
data_security_finding.description: A Data Security Finding describes detections or alerts generated by various data security products such as Data Loss Prevention (DLP), Data Classification, Secrets Management, Digital Rights Management (DRM), Data Security Posture Management (DSPM), and similar tools. These detections or alerts can be created using fingerprinting, statistical analysis, machine learning or other methodologies. The finding describes the actors and endpoints who accessed or own the sensitive data, as well as the resources which store the sensitive data.
data_security_finding.name: data_security_finding

action_id.caption: Action ID
action_id.description: The action taken by a control or other policy-based system leading to an outcome or disposition. Dispositions conform to an action of 1 'Allowed' or 2 'Denied' in most cases. Note that 99 'Other' is not an option. No action would equate to 1 'Allowed'. An unknown action may still correspond to a known disposition. Refer to disposition_id for the outcome of the action.

0.caption: Unknown
0.description: The action was unknown. The disposition_id attribute may still be set to a non-unknown value, for example 'Count', 'Uncorrected', 'Isolated', 'Quarantined' or 'Exonerated'.

1.caption: Allowed
1.description: The activity was allowed. The disposition_id attribute should be set to a value that conforms to this action, for example 'Allowed', 'Approved', 'Delayed', 'No Action', 'Count' etc.

2.caption: Denied
2.description: The attempted activity was denied. The disposition_id attribute should be set to a value that conforms to this action, for example 'Blocked', 'Rejected', 'Quarantined', 'Isolated', 'Dropped', 'Access Revoked, etc.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The action was not mapped. See the action attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

activity_id.caption: Activity ID
activity_id.description: The normalized identifier of the activity that triggered the event.

1.caption: Read
1.description: The 'Read' activity involves accessing specific data record details.

10.caption: Decrypt
10.description: The 'Decrypt' activity involves converting encrypted data back to its original format.

2.caption: Update
2.description: The 'Update' activity pertains to modifying specific data record details.

3.caption: Connect
3.description: The 'Connect' activity involves establishing a connection to the datastore.

4.caption: Query
4.description: The 'Query' activity involves retrieving a filtered subset of data based on specific criteria.

5.caption: Write
5.description: The 'Write' activity involves writing specific data record details.

6.caption: Create
6.description: The 'Create' activity involves generating new data record details.

7.caption: Delete
7.description: The 'Delete' activity involves removing specific data record details.

8.caption: List
8.description: The 'List' activity provides an overview of existing data records.

9.caption: Encrypt
9.description: The 'Encrypt' activity involves securing data by encrypting a specific data record.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The event activity is not mapped. See the activity_name attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

activity_name.caption: Activity
activity_name.description: The event activity name, as defined by the activity_id.

actor.caption: Actor
actor.description: The actor object describes details about the user/role/process that was the source of the activity.

api.caption: API Details
api.description: Describes details about a typical API (Application Programming Interface) call.

attacks.caption: MITRE ATT&CK Details
attacks.description: An array of MITRE ATT&CK objects describing the tactics, techniques & sub-techniques identified by a security control or finding.

authorizations.caption: Authorization Information
authorizations.description: Provides details about an authorization, such as authorization outcome, and any associated policies related to the activity/event.

category_name.caption: Category
category_name.description: The event category name, as defined by category_uid value: Application Activity.

category_uid.caption: Category ID
category_uid.description: The category unique identifier of the event.

6.caption: Application Activity
6.description: Application Activity events report detailed information about the behavior of applications and services.

class_name.caption: Class
class_name.description: The event class name, as defined by class_uid value: Datastore Activity.

class_uid.caption: Class ID
class_uid.description: The unique identifier of a class. A class describes the attributes available in an event.

6005.caption: Datastore Activity
6005.description: Datastore events describe general activities (Read, Update, Query, Delete, etc.) which affect datastores or data within those datastores, e.g. (AWS RDS, AWS S3).

cloud.caption: Cloud
cloud.description: Describes details about the Cloud environment where the event was originally created or logged.

count.caption: Count
count.description: The number of times that events in the same logical group occurred during the event Start Time to End Time period.

database.caption: Database
database.description: The database object is used for databases which are typically datastore services that contain an organized collection of structured and unstructured data or a types of data.

databucket.caption: Databucket
databucket.description: The data bucket object is a basic container that holds data, typically organized through the use of data partitions.

disposition.caption: Disposition
disposition.description: The disposition name, normalized to the caption of the disposition_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

disposition_id.caption: Disposition ID
disposition_id.description: Describes the outcome or action taken by a security control, such as access control checks, malware detections or various types of policy violations.

1.caption: Allowed
1.description: Granted access or allowed the action to the protected resource.

10.caption: Exonerated
10.description: A suspicious or risky entity was deemed to no longer be suspicious (re-scored).

11.caption: Corrected
11.description: A corrupt file or configuration was corrected.

12.caption: Partially Corrected
12.description: A corrupt file or configuration was partially corrected.

13.caption: Uncorrected
13.description: A corrupt file or configuration was not corrected.

14.caption: Delayed
14.description: An operation was delayed, for example if a restart was required to finish the operation.

15.caption: Detected
15.description: Suspicious activity or a policy violation was detected without further action.

16.caption: No Action
16.description: The outcome of an operation had no action taken.

17.caption: Logged
17.description: The operation or action was logged without further action.

18.caption: Tagged
18.description: A file or other entity was marked with extended attributes.

19.caption: Alert
19.description: The request or activity was detected as a threat and resulted in a notification but request was not blocked.

2.caption: Blocked
2.description: Denied access or blocked the action to the protected resource.

20.caption: Count
20.description: Counted the request or activity but did not determine whether to allow it or block it.

21.caption: Reset
21.description: The request was detected as a threat and resulted in the connection being reset.

22.caption: Captcha
22.description: Required the end user to solve a CAPTCHA puzzle to prove that a human being is sending the request.

23.caption: Challenge
23.description: Ran a silent challenge that required the client session to verify that it's a browser, and not a bot.

24.caption: Access Revoked
24.description: The requestor's access has been revoked due to security policy enforcements. Note: use the Host profile if the User or Actor requestor is not present in the event class.

25.caption: Rejected
25.description: A request or submission was rejected. For example, when a form was improperly filled out and submitted. This is distinct from 2 'Blocked'.

26.caption: Unauthorized
26.description: An attempt to access a resource was denied due to an authorization check that failed. This is a more specific disposition than 2 'Blocked' and can be complemented with the authorizations attribute for more detail.

27.caption: Error
27.description: An error occurred during the processing of the activity or request. Use the message attribute of the base class for details.

3.caption: Quarantined
3.description: A suspicious file or other content was moved to a benign location.

4.caption: Isolated
4.description: A session was isolated on the network or within a browser.

5.caption: Deleted
5.description: A file or other content was deleted.

6.caption: Dropped
6.description: The request was detected as a threat and resulted in the connection being dropped.

7.caption: Custom Action
7.description: A custom action was executed such as running of a command script. Use the message attribute of the base class for details.

8.caption: Approved
8.description: A request or submission was approved. For example, when a form was properly filled out and submitted. This is distinct from 1 'Allowed'.

9.caption: Restored
9.description: A quarantined file or other content was restored to its original location.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The disposition is not mapped. See the disposition attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

dst_endpoint.caption: Destination Endpoint
dst_endpoint.description: Details about the endpoint hosting the datastore application or service.

duration.caption: Duration Milliseconds
duration.description: The event duration or aggregate time, the amount of time the event covers from start_time to end_time in milliseconds.

end_time.caption: End Time
end_time.description: The end time of a time period, or the time of the most recent event included in the aggregate event.

end_time_dt.caption: End Time
end_time_dt.description: The end time of a time period, or the time of the most recent event included in the aggregate event.

enrichments.caption: Enrichments
enrichments.description:
The additional information from an external data source, which is associated with the event or a finding. For example add location information for the IP address in the DNS answers:

[{"name": "answers.ip", "value": "92.24.47.250", "type": "location", "data": {"city": "Socotra", "continent": "Asia", "coordinates": [-25.4153, 17.0743], "country": "YE", "desc": "Yemen"}}]

firewall_rule.caption: Firewall Rule
firewall_rule.description: The firewall rule that triggered the event.

message.caption: Message
message.description: The description of the event/finding, as defined by the source.

metadata.caption: Metadata
metadata.description: The metadata associated with the event or a finding.

observables.caption: Observables
observables.description: The observables associated with the event or a finding.

osint.caption: OSINT
osint.description: The OSINT (Open Source Intelligence) object contains details related to an indicator such as the indicator itself, related indicators, geolocation, registrar information, subdomains, analyst commentary, and other contextual information. This information can be used to further enrich a detection or finding by providing decisioning support to other analysts and engineers.

query_info.caption: Query Info
query_info.description: The query info object holds information related to data access within a datastore. To access, manipulate, delete, or retrieve data from a datastore, a database query must be written using a specific syntax.

raw_data.caption: Raw Data
raw_data.description: The raw event/finding data as received from the source.

severity.description: The event/finding severity, normalized to the caption of the severity_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the source.

severity_id.caption: Severity ID
severity_id.description:
The normalized identifier of the event/finding severity.

The normalized severity is a measurement the effort and expense required to manage and resolve an event or incident. Smaller numerical values represent lower impact events, and larger numerical values represent higher impact events.

1.caption: Informational
1.description: Informational message. No action required.

2.caption: Low
2.description: The user decides if action is needed.

3.caption: Medium
3.description: Action is required but the situation is not serious at this time.

5.caption: Critical
5.description: Action is required immediately and the scope is broad.

6.caption: Fatal
6.description: An error occurred but it is too late to take remedial action.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The event/finding severity is not mapped. See the severity attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

src_endpoint.caption: Source Endpoint
src_endpoint.description: Details about the source of the activity.

start_time.description: The start time of a time period, or the time of the least recent event included in the aggregate event.

start_time_dt.caption: Start Time
start_time_dt.description: The start time of a time period, or the time of the least recent event included in the aggregate event.

severity.description: The event/finding severity, normalized to the caption of the severity_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the source.

severity_id.caption: Severity ID
severity_id.description:
The normalized identifier of the event/finding severity.

The normalized severity is a measurement the effort and expense required to manage and resolve an event or incident. Smaller numerical values represent lower impact events, and larger numerical values represent higher impact events.

1.caption: Informational
1.description: Informational message. No action required.

2.caption: Low
2.description: The user decides if action is needed.

3.caption: Medium
3.description: Action is required but the situation is not serious at this time.

5.caption: Critical
5.description: Action is required immediately and the scope is broad.

6.caption: Fatal
6.description: An error occurred but it is too late to take remedial action.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The event/finding severity is not mapped. See the severity attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

start_time.caption: Start Time
start_time.description: The time of the least recent event included in the finding.

start_time_dt.caption: Start Time
start_time_dt.description: The time of the least recent event included in the finding.

status.caption: Status
status.description: The normalized status of the Finding set by the consumer normalized to the caption of the status_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the source.

status_code.caption: Status Code
status_code.description:
The event status code, as reported by the event source.

For example, in a Windows Failed Authentication event, this would be the value of 'Failure Code', e.g. 0x18.

status_detail.caption: Status Detail
status_detail.description: The status detail contains additional information about the event/finding outcome.

status_id.caption: Status ID
status_id.description: The normalized status identifier of the Finding, set by the consumer.

1.caption: New
1.description: The Finding is new and yet to be reviewed.

2.caption: In Progress
2.description: The Finding is under review.

3.caption: Suppressed
3.description: The Finding was reviewed, determined to be benign or a false positive and is now suppressed.

4.caption: Resolved
4.description: The Finding was reviewed, remediated and is now considered resolved.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The event status is not mapped. See the status attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

time.caption: Event Time
time.description: The normalized event occurrence time or the finding creation time.

time_dt.caption: Event Time
time_dt.description: The normalized event occurrence time or the finding creation time.

timezone_offset.caption: Timezone Offset
timezone_offset.description: The number of minutes that the reported event time is ahead or behind UTC, in the range -1,080 to +1,080.

type_name.caption: Type Name
type_name.description: The event/finding type name, as defined by the type_uid.

type_uid.caption: Type ID
type_uid.description: The event/finding type ID. It identifies the event's semantics and structure. The value is calculated by the logging system as: class_uid * 100 + activity_id.

unmapped.caption: Unmapped Data
unmapped.description: The attributes that are not mapped to the event schema. The names and values of those attributes are specific to the event source.

action_id.caption: Action ID
action_id.description: The action taken by a control or other policy-based system leading to an outcome or disposition. Dispositions conform to an action of 1 'Allowed' or 2 'Denied' in most cases. Note that 99 'Other' is not an option. No action would equate to 1 'Allowed'. An unknown action may still correspond to a known disposition. Refer to disposition_id for the outcome of the action.

0.caption: Unknown
0.description: The action was unknown. The disposition_id attribute may still be set to a non-unknown value, for example 'Count', 'Uncorrected', 'Isolated', 'Quarantined' or 'Exonerated'.

1.caption: Allowed
1.description: The activity was allowed. The disposition_id attribute should be set to a value that conforms to this action, for example 'Allowed', 'Approved', 'Delayed', 'No Action', 'Count' etc.

2.caption: Denied
2.description: The attempted activity was denied. The disposition_id attribute should be set to a value that conforms to this action, for example 'Blocked', 'Rejected', 'Quarantined', 'Isolated', 'Dropped', 'Access Revoked, etc.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The action was not mapped. See the action attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

activity_id.description: The normalized identifier of the activity that triggered the event.

6.caption: Nak
6.description: DHCPNAK

7.caption: Release
7.description: DHCPRELEASE: A DHCP client sends a DHCPRELEASE packet to the server to release the IP address and cancel any remaining lease.

8.caption: Inform
8.description: DHCPINFORM

9.caption: Expire
9.description: DHCPEXPIRE: A DHCP lease expired.

cloud.caption: Cloud

count.caption: Count
count.description: The number of times that events in the same logical group occurred during the event Start Time to End Time period.

device.caption: Device
device.description: An addressable device, computer system or host.

disposition.caption: Disposition
disposition.description: The disposition name, normalized to the caption of the disposition_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

disposition_id.caption: Disposition ID
disposition_id.description: Describes the outcome or action taken by a security control, such as access control checks, malware detections or various types of policy violations.

1.caption: Allowed
1.description: Granted access or allowed the action to the protected resource.

10.caption: Exonerated
10.description: A suspicious or risky entity was deemed to no longer be suspicious (re-scored).

11.caption: Corrected
11.description: A corrupt file or configuration was corrected.

12.caption: Partially Corrected
12.description: A corrupt file or configuration was partially corrected.

13.caption: Uncorrected
13.description: A corrupt file or configuration was not corrected.

14.caption: Delayed
14.description: An operation was delayed, for example if a restart was required to finish the operation.

15.caption: Detected
15.description: Suspicious activity or a policy violation was detected without further action.

16.caption: No Action
16.description: The outcome of an operation had no action taken.

17.caption: Logged
17.description: The operation or action was logged without further action.

18.caption: Tagged
18.description: A file or other entity was marked with extended attributes.

19.caption: Alert
19.description: The request or activity was detected as a threat and resulted in a notification but request was not blocked.

2.caption: Blocked
2.description: Denied access or blocked the action to the protected resource.

20.caption: Count
20.description: Counted the request or activity but did not determine whether to allow it or block it.

21.caption: Reset
21.description: The request was detected as a threat and resulted in the connection being reset.

22.caption: Captcha
22.description: Required the end user to solve a CAPTCHA puzzle to prove that a human being is sending the request.

23.caption: Challenge
23.description: Ran a silent challenge that required the client session to verify that it's a browser, and not a bot.

24.caption: Access Revoked
24.description: The requestor's access has been revoked due to security policy enforcements. Note: use the Host profile if the User or Actor requestor is not present in the event class.

25.caption: Rejected
25.description: A request or submission was rejected. For example, when a form was improperly filled out and submitted. This is distinct from 2 'Blocked'.

26.caption: Unauthorized
26.description: An attempt to access a resource was denied due to an authorization check that failed. This is a more specific disposition than 2 'Blocked' and can be complemented with the authorizations attribute for more detail.

27.caption: Error
27.description: An error occurred during the processing of the activity or request. Use the message attribute of the base class for details.

3.caption: Quarantined
3.description: A suspicious file or other content was moved to a benign location.

4.caption: Isolated
4.description: A session was isolated on the network or within a browser.

5.caption: Deleted
5.description: A file or other content was deleted.

6.caption: Dropped
6.description: The request was detected as a threat and resulted in the connection being dropped.

7.caption: Custom Action
7.description: A custom action was executed such as running of a command script. Use the message attribute of the base class for details.

8.caption: Approved
8.description: A request or submission was approved. For example, when a form was properly filled out and submitted. This is distinct from 1 'Allowed'.

9.caption: Restored
9.description: A quarantined file or other content was restored to its original location.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The disposition is not mapped. See the disposition attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

dst_endpoint.description: The responder (server) of the DHCP connection.

count.description: The number of times that events in the same logical group occurred during the event Start Time to End Time period.

device.caption: Device
device.description: An addressable device, computer system or host.

disposition.caption: Disposition
disposition.description: The disposition name, normalized to the caption of the disposition_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

disposition_id.caption: Disposition ID
disposition_id.description: Describes the outcome or action taken by a security control, such as access control checks, malware detections or various types of policy violations.

1.caption: Allowed
1.description: Granted access or allowed the action to the protected resource.

10.caption: Exonerated
10.description: A suspicious or risky entity was deemed to no longer be suspicious (re-scored).

11.caption: Corrected
11.description: A corrupt file or configuration was corrected.

12.caption: Partially Corrected
12.description: A corrupt file or configuration was partially corrected.

13.caption: Uncorrected
13.description: A corrupt file or configuration was not corrected.

14.caption: Delayed
14.description: An operation was delayed, for example if a restart was required to finish the operation.

15.caption: Detected
15.description: Suspicious activity or a policy violation was detected without further action.

16.caption: No Action
16.description: The outcome of an operation had no action taken.

17.caption: Logged
17.description: The operation or action was logged without further action.

18.caption: Tagged
18.description: A file or other entity was marked with extended attributes.

19.caption: Alert
19.description: The request or activity was detected as a threat and resulted in a notification but request was not blocked.

2.caption: Blocked
2.description: Denied access or blocked the action to the protected resource.

20.caption: Count
20.description: Counted the request or activity but did not determine whether to allow it or block it.

21.caption: Reset
21.description: The request was detected as a threat and resulted in the connection being reset.

22.caption: Captcha
22.description: Required the end user to solve a CAPTCHA puzzle to prove that a human being is sending the request.

23.caption: Challenge
23.description: Ran a silent challenge that required the client session to verify that it's a browser, and not a bot.

24.caption: Access Revoked
24.description: The requestor's access has been revoked due to security policy enforcements. Note: use the Host profile if the User or Actor requestor is not present in the event class.

25.caption: Rejected
25.description: A request or submission was rejected. For example, when a form was improperly filled out and submitted. This is distinct from 2 'Blocked'.

26.caption: Unauthorized
26.description: An attempt to access a resource was denied due to an authorization check that failed. This is a more specific disposition than 2 'Blocked' and can be complemented with the authorizations attribute for more detail.

27.caption: Error
27.description: An error occurred during the processing of the activity or request. Use the message attribute of the base class for details.

3.caption: Quarantined
3.description: A suspicious file or other content was moved to a benign location.

4.caption: Isolated
4.description: A session was isolated on the network or within a browser.

5.caption: Deleted
5.description: A file or other content was deleted.

6.caption: Dropped
6.description: The request was detected as a threat and resulted in the connection being dropped.

7.caption: Custom Action
7.description: A custom action was executed such as running of a command script. Use the message attribute of the base class for details.

8.caption: Approved
8.description: A request or submission was approved. For example, when a form was properly filled out and submitted. This is distinct from 1 'Allowed'.

9.caption: Restored
9.description: A quarantined file or other content was restored to its original location.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The disposition is not mapped. See the disposition attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

dst_endpoint.caption: Destination Endpoint
dst_endpoint.description: The responder (server) in a network connection.

duration.caption: Duration Milliseconds
duration.description: The event duration or aggregate time, the amount of time the event covers from start_time to end_time in milliseconds.

end_time.caption: End Time
end_time.description: The end time of a time period, or the time of the most recent event included in the aggregate event.

end_time_dt.caption: End Time
end_time_dt.description: The end time of a time period, or the time of the most recent event included in the aggregate event.

enrichments.caption: Enrichments
enrichments.description:
The additional information from an external data source, which is associated with the event or a finding. For example add location information for the IP address in the DNS answers:

[{"name": "answers.ip", "value": "92.24.47.250", "type": "location", "data": {"city": "Socotra", "continent": "Asia", "coordinates": [-25.4153, 17.0743], "country": "YE", "desc": "Yemen"}}]

firewall_rule.caption: Firewall Rule
firewall_rule.description: The firewall rule that triggered the event.

ja4_fingerprint_list.caption: JA4+ Fingerprints
ja4_fingerprint_list.description: A list of the JA4+ network fingerprints.

load_balancer.caption: Load Balancer
load_balancer.description: The Load Balancer object contains information related to the device that is distributing incoming traffic to specified destinations.

malware.caption: Malware
malware.description: A list of Malware objects, describing details about the identified malware.

message.caption: Message
message.description: The description of the event/finding, as defined by the source.

metadata.caption: Metadata
metadata.description: The metadata associated with the event or a finding.

observables.caption: Observables
observables.description: The observables associated with the event or a finding.

osint.caption: OSINT
osint.description: The OSINT (Open Source Intelligence) object contains details related to an indicator such as the indicator itself, related indicators, geolocation, registrar information, subdomains, analyst commentary, and other contextual information. This information can be used to further enrich a detection or finding by providing decisioning support to other analysts and engineers.

proxy.caption: Proxy
proxy.description: The proxy (server) in a network connection.

proxy_connection_info.caption: Proxy Connection Info
proxy_connection_info.description: The connection information from the proxy server to the remote server.

proxy_endpoint.caption: Proxy Endpoint
proxy_endpoint.description: The proxy (server) in a network connection.

proxy_http_request.caption: Proxy HTTP Request
proxy_http_request.description: The HTTP Request from the proxy server to the remote server.

proxy_http_response.caption: Proxy HTTP Response
proxy_http_response.description: The HTTP Response from the remote server to the proxy server.

proxy_tls.caption: Proxy TLS
proxy_tls.description: The TLS protocol negotiated between the proxy server and the remote server.

proxy_traffic.caption: Proxy Traffic
proxy_traffic.description: The network traffic refers to the amount of data moving across a network, from proxy to remote server at a given point of time.

query_time.caption: Query Time
query_time.description: The Domain Name System (DNS) query time.

query_time_dt.caption: Query Time
query_time_dt.description: The Domain Name System (DNS) query time.

raw_data.caption: Raw Data
raw_data.description: The raw event/finding data as received from the source.

rcode.caption: Response Code
rcode.description: The DNS server response code, normalized to the caption of the rcode_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

rcode_id.caption: Response Code ID
rcode_id.description: The normalized identifier of the DNS server response code. See RFC-6895.

1.caption: FormError
1.description: Format Error.

10.caption: NotZone
10.description: Name not contained in zone.

11.caption: DSOTYPENI
11.description: DSO-TYPE Not Implemented.

16.caption: BADSIG_VERS
16.description: TSIG Signature Failure or Bad OPT Version.

17.caption: BADKEY
17.description: Key not recognized.

18.caption: BADTIME
18.description: Signature out of time window.

19.caption: BADMODE
19.description: Bad TKEY Mode.

2.caption: ServError
2.description: Server Failure.

20.caption: BADNAME
20.description: Duplicate key name.

21.caption: BADALG
21.description: Algorithm not supported.

22.caption: BADTRUNC
22.description: Bad Truncation.

23.caption: BADCOOKIE
23.description: Bad/missing Server Cookie.

24.caption: Unassigned
24.description: The codes deemed to be unassigned by the RFC (unassigned codes: 12-15, 24-3840, 4096-65534).

25.caption: Reserved
25.description: The codes deemed to be reserved by the RFC (codes: 3841-4095, 65535).

3.caption: NXDomain
3.description: Non-Existent Domain.

5.caption: Refused
5.description: Query Refused.

6.caption: YXDomain
6.description: Name Exists when it should not.

7.caption: YXRRSet
7.description: RR Set Exists when it should not.

8.caption: NXRRSet
8.description: RR Set that should exist does not.

9.caption: NotAuth
9.description: Not Authorized or Server Not Authoritative for zone.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The dns response code is not defined by the RFC.

response_time.caption: Response Time
response_time.description: The Domain Name System (DNS) response time.

response_time_dt.caption: Response Time
response_time_dt.description: The Domain Name System (DNS) response time.

severity.caption: Severity
severity.description: The event/finding severity, normalized to the caption of the severity_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the source.

severity_id.caption: Severity ID
severity_id.description:
The normalized identifier of the event/finding severity.

The normalized severity is a measurement the effort and expense required to manage and resolve an event or incident. Smaller numerical values represent lower impact events, and larger numerical values represent higher impact events.

1.caption: Informational
1.description: Informational message. No action required.

2.caption: Low
2.description: The user decides if action is needed.

3.caption: Medium
3.description: Action is required but the situation is not serious at this time.

5.caption: Critical
5.description: Action is required immediately and the scope is broad.

6.caption: Fatal
6.description: An error occurred but it is too late to take remedial action.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The event/finding severity is not mapped. See the severity attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

src_endpoint.caption: Source Endpoint
src_endpoint.description: The initiator (client) of the network connection.

start_time.caption: Start Time
start_time.description: The start time of a time period, or the time of the least recent event included in the aggregate event.

start_time_dt.caption: Start Time
start_time_dt.description: The start time of a time period, or the time of the least recent event included in the aggregate event.

status.caption: Status
status.description: The event status, normalized to the caption of the status_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

status_code.caption: Status Code
status_code.description:
The event status code, as reported by the event source.

For example, in a Windows Failed Authentication event, this would be the value of 'Failure Code', e.g. 0x18.

status_detail.caption: Status Detail
status_detail.description: The status detail contains additional information about the event/finding outcome.

status_id.caption: Status ID
status_id.description: The normalized identifier of the event status.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The event status is not mapped. See the status attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

time.caption: Event Time
time.description: The normalized event occurrence time or the finding creation time.

time_dt.caption: Event Time
time_dt.description: The normalized event occurrence time or the finding creation time.

timezone_offset.caption: Timezone Offset
timezone_offset.description: The number of minutes that the reported event time is ahead or behind UTC, in the range -1,080 to +1,080.

traffic.caption: Traffic
traffic.description: The network traffic refers to the amount of data moving across a network at a given point of time. Intended to be used alongside Network Connection.

type_name.caption: Type Name
type_name.description: The event/finding type name, as defined by the type_uid.

type_uid.caption: Type ID
type_uid.description: The event/finding type ID. It identifies the event's semantics and structure. The value is calculated by the logging system as: class_uid * 100 + activity_id.

400306.caption: DNS Activity: Traffic
400306.description: Bidirectional DNS request and response traffic.

unmapped.caption: Unmapped Data
unmapped.description: The attributes that are not mapped to the event schema. The names and values of those attributes are specific to the event source.

dns_activity.caption: DNS Activity
dns_activity.description: DNS Activity events report DNS queries and answers as seen on the network.
dns_activity.name: dns_activity

action_id.caption: Action ID
action_id.description: The action taken by a control or other policy-based system leading to an outcome or disposition. Dispositions conform to an action of 1 'Allowed' or 2 'Denied' in most cases. Note that 99 'Other' is not an option. No action would equate to 1 'Allowed'. An unknown action may still correspond to a known disposition. Refer to disposition_id for the outcome of the action.

0.caption: Unknown
0.description: The action was unknown. The disposition_id attribute may still be set to a non-unknown value, for example 'Count', 'Uncorrected', 'Isolated', 'Quarantined' or 'Exonerated'.

1.caption: Allowed
1.description: The activity was allowed. The disposition_id attribute should be set to a value that conforms to this action, for example 'Allowed', 'Approved', 'Delayed', 'No Action', 'Count' etc.

2.caption: Denied
2.description: The attempted activity was denied. The disposition_id attribute should be set to a value that conforms to this action, for example 'Blocked', 'Rejected', 'Quarantined', 'Isolated', 'Dropped', 'Access Revoked, etc.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The action was not mapped. See the action attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

activity_id.caption: Activity ID
activity_id.description: The normalized identifier of the activity that triggered the event.

3.caption: Scan
3.description: Email being scanned (example: security scanning)

99.caption: Other
99.description: The event activity is not mapped. See the activity_name attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

activity_name.caption: Activity
activity_name.description: The event activity name, as defined by the activity_id.

actor.caption: Actor
actor.description: The actor object describes details about the user/role/process that was the source of the activity.

api.caption: API Details
api.description: Describes details about a typical API (Application Programming Interface) call.

attacks.caption: MITRE ATT&CK Details
attacks.description: An array of MITRE ATT&CK objects describing the tactics, techniques & sub-techniques identified by a security control or finding.

attempt.caption: Attempt
attempt.description: The attempt number for attempting to deliver the email.

authorizations.caption: Authorization Information
authorizations.description: Provides details about an authorization, such as authorization outcome, and any associated policies related to the activity/event.

banner.caption: SMTP Banner
banner.description: The initial SMTP connection response that a messaging server receives after it connects to a email server.

category_uid.description: The category unique identifier of the event.

direction_id.caption: Direction ID
direction_id.description:
The direction of the email relative to the scanning host or organization.

Email scanned at an internet gateway might be characterized as inbound to the organization from the Internet, outbound from the organization to the Internet, or internal within the organization. Email scanned at a workstation might be characterized as inbound to, or outbound from the workstation.

1.caption: Inbound
1.description: Email Inbound, from the Internet or outside network destined for an entity inside network.

2.caption: Outbound
2.description: Email Outbound, from inside the network destined for an entity outside network.

3.caption: Internal
3.description: Email Internal, from inside the network destined for an entity inside network.

13.description: A corrupt file or configuration was not corrected.

14.caption: Delayed
14.description: An operation was delayed, for example if a restart was required to finish the operation.

15.caption: Detected
15.description: Suspicious activity or a policy violation was detected without further action.

16.caption: No Action
16.description: The outcome of an operation had no action taken.

17.caption: Logged
17.description: The operation or action was logged without further action.

18.caption: Tagged
18.description: A file or other entity was marked with extended attributes.

19.caption: Alert
19.description: The request or activity was detected as a threat and resulted in a notification but request was not blocked.

2.caption: Blocked
2.description: Denied access or blocked the action to the protected resource.

20.caption: Count
20.description: Counted the request or activity but did not determine whether to allow it or block it.

21.caption: Reset
21.description: The request was detected as a threat and resulted in the connection being reset.

22.caption: Captcha
22.description: Required the end user to solve a CAPTCHA puzzle to prove that a human being is sending the request.

23.caption: Challenge
23.description: Ran a silent challenge that required the client session to verify that it's a browser, and not a bot.

24.caption: Access Revoked
24.description: The requestor's access has been revoked due to security policy enforcements. Note: use the Host profile if the User or Actor requestor is not present in the event class.

25.caption: Rejected
25.description: A request or submission was rejected. For example, when a form was improperly filled out and submitted. This is distinct from 2 'Blocked'.

26.caption: Unauthorized
26.description: An attempt to access a resource was denied due to an authorization check that failed. This is a more specific disposition than 2 'Blocked' and can be complemented with the authorizations attribute for more detail.

27.caption: Error
27.description: An error occurred during the processing of the activity or request. Use the message attribute of the base class for details.

3.caption: Quarantined
3.description: A suspicious file or other content was moved to a benign location.

4.caption: Isolated
4.description: A session was isolated on the network or within a browser.

5.caption: Deleted
5.description: A file or other content was deleted.

6.caption: Dropped
6.description: The request was detected as a threat and resulted in the connection being dropped.

7.caption: Custom Action
7.description: A custom action was executed such as running of a command script. Use the message attribute of the base class for details.

8.caption: Approved
8.description: A request or submission was approved. For example, when a form was properly filled out and submitted. This is distinct from 1 'Allowed'.

9.caption: Restored
9.description: A quarantined file or other content was restored to its original location.

The normalized severity is a measurement the effort and expense required to manage and resolve an event or incident. Smaller numerical values represent lower impact events, and larger numerical values represent higher impact events.

1.description: Informational message. No action required.

2.caption: Low

action_id.caption: Action ID
action_id.description: The action taken by a control or other policy-based system leading to an outcome or disposition. Dispositions conform to an action of 1 'Allowed' or 2 'Denied' in most cases. Note that 99 'Other' is not an option. No action would equate to 1 'Allowed'. An unknown action may still correspond to a known disposition. Refer to disposition_id for the outcome of the action.

0.caption: Unknown
0.description: The action was unknown. The disposition_id attribute may still be set to a non-unknown value, for example 'Count', 'Uncorrected', 'Isolated', 'Quarantined' or 'Exonerated'.

1.caption: Allowed
1.description: The activity was allowed. The disposition_id attribute should be set to a value that conforms to this action, for example 'Allowed', 'Approved', 'Delayed', 'No Action', 'Count' etc.

2.caption: Denied
2.description: The attempted activity was denied. The disposition_id attribute should be set to a value that conforms to this action, for example 'Blocked', 'Rejected', 'Quarantined', 'Isolated', 'Dropped', 'Access Revoked, etc.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The action was not mapped. See the action attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

2.caption: Denied

99.caption: Other
99.description: The action was not mapped. See the action attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

1008.description: Event Log Activity events report actions pertaining to the system's event logging service(s), such as disabling logging or clearing the log data.

cloud.caption: Cloud
cloud.description: Describes details about the Cloud environment where the event was originally created or logged.

count.caption: Count
count.description: The number of times that events in the same logical group occurred during the event Start Time to End Time period.

device.caption: Device
device.description: The device that reported the event.

disposition.caption: Disposition
disposition.description: The disposition name, normalized to the caption of the disposition_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

disposition_id.caption: Disposition ID
disposition_id.description: Describes the outcome or action taken by a security control, such as access control checks, malware detections or various types of policy violations.

1.caption: Allowed
1.description: Granted access or allowed the action to the protected resource.

10.caption: Exonerated
10.description: A suspicious or risky entity was deemed to no longer be suspicious (re-scored).

11.caption: Corrected
11.description: A corrupt file or configuration was corrected.

12.caption: Partially Corrected
12.description: A corrupt file or configuration was partially corrected.

13.caption: Uncorrected
13.description: A corrupt file or configuration was not corrected.

14.caption: Delayed
14.description: An operation was delayed, for example if a restart was required to finish the operation.

15.caption: Detected
15.description: Suspicious activity or a policy violation was detected without further action.

16.caption: No Action
16.description: The outcome of an operation had no action taken.

17.caption: Logged
17.description: The operation or action was logged without further action.

18.caption: Tagged
18.description: A file or other entity was marked with extended attributes.

19.caption: Alert
19.description: The request or activity was detected as a threat and resulted in a notification but request was not blocked.

2.caption: Blocked
2.description: Denied access or blocked the action to the protected resource.

20.caption: Count
20.description: Counted the request or activity but did not determine whether to allow it or block it.

21.caption: Reset
21.description: The request was detected as a threat and resulted in the connection being reset.

22.caption: Captcha
22.description: Required the end user to solve a CAPTCHA puzzle to prove that a human being is sending the request.

23.caption: Challenge
23.description: Ran a silent challenge that required the client session to verify that it's a browser, and not a bot.

24.caption: Access Revoked
24.description: The requestor's access has been revoked due to security policy enforcements. Note: use the Host profile if the User or Actor requestor is not present in the event class.

25.caption: Rejected
25.description: A request or submission was rejected. For example, when a form was improperly filled out and submitted. This is distinct from 2 'Blocked'.

26.caption: Unauthorized
26.description: An attempt to access a resource was denied due to an authorization check that failed. This is a more specific disposition than 2 'Blocked' and can be complemented with the authorizations attribute for more detail.

27.caption: Error
27.description: An error occurred during the processing of the activity or request. Use the message attribute of the base class for details.

4.caption: Isolated

5.caption: Deleted

6.caption: Dropped

7.caption: Custom Action

8.caption: Approved

targeted by

severity_id.description:
The normalized identifier of the event/finding severity.

The normalized severity is a measurement the effort and expense required to manage and resolve an event or incident. Smaller numerical values represent lower impact events, and larger numerical values represent higher impact events.

1.caption: Informational
1.description: Informational message. No action required.

2.caption: Low
2.description: The user decides if action is needed.

3.caption: Medium
3.description: Action is required but the situation is not serious at this time.

5.caption: Critical
5.description: Action is required immediately and the scope is broad.

6.caption: Fatal
6.description: An error occurred but it is too late to take remedial action.

2.caption: Evict
2.description: Removes an adversary or malicious resource from a device or computer network. Defined by D3FEND d3f:Evict.

3.caption: Restore
3.description: Returns the system to a better state. Defined by D3FEND d3f:Restore.

4.caption: Harden
4.description: Increases the opportunity cost of computer network exploitation. Defined by D3FEND d3f:Harden.

unmapped.description: The attributes that are not mapped to the event schema. The names and values of those attributes are specific to the event source.

folder_query.caption: Folder Query
folder_query.description: Folder Query events report information about folders that are present on the system.
folder_query.name: folder_query

action_id.caption: Action ID
action_id.description: The action taken by a control or other policy-based system leading to an outcome or disposition. Dispositions conform to an action of 1 'Allowed' or 2 'Denied' in most cases. Note that 99 'Other' is not an option. No action would equate to 1 'Allowed'. An unknown action may still correspond to a known disposition. Refer to disposition_id for the outcome of the action.

0.caption: Unknown
0.description: The action was unknown. The disposition_id attribute may still be set to a non-unknown value, for example 'Count', 'Uncorrected', 'Isolated', 'Quarantined' or 'Exonerated'.

1.caption: Allowed
1.description: The activity was allowed. The disposition_id attribute should be set to a value that conforms to this action, for example 'Allowed', 'Approved', 'Delayed', 'No Action', 'Count' etc.

2.caption: Denied
2.description: The attempted activity was denied. The disposition_id attribute should be set to a value that conforms to this action, for example 'Blocked', 'Rejected', 'Quarantined', 'Isolated', 'Dropped', 'Access Revoked, etc.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The action was not mapped. See the action attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

activity_id.caption: Activity ID
activity_id.description: The normalized identifier of the activity that triggered the event.

1.caption: Put
1.description: File upload to the FTP or SFTP site.

2.caption: Get
2.description: File download from the FTP or SFTP site.

3.caption: Poll
3.description: Poll directory for specific file(s) or folder(s) at the FTP or SFTP site location.

4.caption: Delete
4.description: Delete file(s) from the FTP or SFTP site.

5.caption: Rename
5.description: Rename the file(s) in the FTP or SFTP site.

6.caption: List
6.description: List files in a specified directory.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The event activity is not mapped. See the activity_name attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

activity_name.caption: Activity
activity_name.description: The event activity name, as defined by the activity_id.

actor.caption: Actor
actor.description: The actor object describes details about the user/role/process that was the source of the activity.

api.caption: API Details
api.description: Describes details about a typical API (Application Programming Interface) call.

app_name.caption: Application Name
app_name.description: The name of the application associated with the event or object.

attacks.caption: MITRE ATT&CK Details
attacks.description: An array of MITRE ATT&CK objects describing the tactics, techniques & sub-techniques identified by a security control or finding.

authorizations.caption: Authorization Information
authorizations.description: Provides details about an authorization, such as authorization outcome, and any associated policies related to the activity/event.

category_name.caption: Category
category_name.description: The event category name, as defined by category_uid value: Network Activity.

category_uid.caption: Category ID
category_uid.description: The category unique identifier of the event.

class_name.caption: Class
class_name.description: The event class name, as defined by class_uid value: FTP Activity.

class_uid.description: The unique identifier of a class. A class describes the attributes available in an event.
