port.description: The TCP/UDP port number associated with a connection. See specific usage.

postal_code.caption: Postal Code
postal_code.description: The postal code of the location.

precision.caption: Precision
precision.description: The numeric precision. See specific usage.

prev_security_level.caption: Previous Security Level
prev_security_level.description: The previous security level of the entity

prev_security_level_id.caption: Previous Security Level ID
prev_security_level_id.description: The previous security level of the entity

99.caption: Other
99.description: The security level is not mapped. See the prev_security_level attribute, which contains data source specific values.

prev_security_states.caption: Previous Security States
prev_security_states.description: The previous security states. See specific usage.

priority.caption: Priority
priority.description: The priority, normalized to the caption of the priority_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

priority_id.caption: Priority ID
priority_id.description: The normalized priority. Priority identifies the relative importance of the finding. It is a measurement of urgency.

1.caption: Low
1.description: Application or personal procedure is unusable, where a workaround is available or a repair is possible.

2.caption: Medium
2.description: Non-critical function or procedure is unusable or hard to use causing operational disruptions with no direct impact on a service's availability. A workaround is available.

3.caption: High
3.description: Critical functionality or network access is interrupted, degraded or unusable, having a severe impact on services availability. No acceptable alternative is possible.

4.caption: Critical
4.description: Interruption making a critical functionality inaccessible or a complete network interruption causing a severe impact on services availability. There is no possible alternative.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The priority is not normalized.

processed_time.caption: Processed Time
processed_time.description: The event processed time, such as an ETL operation.

processed_time_dt.caption: Processed Time
processed_time_dt.description: The event processed time, such as an ETL operation.

product.caption: Product
product.description: The product that reported the event.

profiles.caption: Profiles
profiles.description: The list of profiles used to create the event. Profiles should be referenced by their name attribute for core profiles, or extension/name for profiles from extensions.

project_uid.caption: Project ID
project_uid.description: The unique identifier of a Cloud project.

protocol_name.caption: Protocol Name
protocol_name.description: The TCP/IP protocol name in lowercase, as defined by the Internet Assigned Numbers Authority (IANA). See Protocol Numbers. For example: tcp or udp.

protocol_num.caption: Protocol Number
protocol_num.description: The TCP/IP protocol number, as defined by the Internet Assigned Numbers Authority (IANA). Use -1 if the protocol is not defined by IANA. See Protocol Numbers. For example: 6 for TCP and 17 for UDP.

protocol_ver.caption: Protocol Version
protocol_ver.description: The Protocol version, normalized to the caption of the protocol_ver_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

protocol_ver_id.caption: Protocol Version ID
protocol_ver_id.description: The normalized identifier of the Protocol version. See specific usage.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The protocol version is not mapped. See the protocol_ver attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

provider.caption: Provider
provider.description: The origin of information associated with the event. See specific usage.

proxy.caption: Proxy
proxy.description: The proxy (server) in a network connection.

proxy_connection_info.caption: Proxy Connection Info
proxy_connection_info.description: The connection information from the proxy server to the remote server.

proxy_endpoint.caption: Proxy Endpoint
proxy_endpoint.description: The proxy (server) in a network connection.

proxy_http_request.caption: Proxy HTTP Request
proxy_http_request.description: The HTTP Request from the proxy server to the remote server.

proxy_http_response.caption: Proxy HTTP Response
proxy_http_response.description: The HTTP Response from the remote server to the proxy server.

proxy_tls.caption: Proxy TLS
proxy_tls.description: The TLS protocol negotiated between the proxy server and the remote server.

proxy_traffic.caption: Proxy Traffic
proxy_traffic.description: The network traffic refers to the amount of data moving across a network, from proxy to remote server at a given point of time.

purl.caption: Package URL
purl.description: A purl is a URL string used to identify and locate a software package in a mostly universal and uniform way across programming languages, package managers, packaging conventions, tools, APIs and databases.

query_info.caption: Query Info
query_info.description: The query info object holds information related to data access within a datastore. To access, manipulate, delete, or retrieve data from a datastore, a database query must be written using a specific syntax.

query_result_id.caption: Query Result ID
query_result_id.description: The normalized identifier of the query result.

1.caption: Exists
1.description: The target was found.

2.caption: Partial
2.description: The target was partially found.

3.caption: Does not exist
3.description: The target was not found.

5.caption: Unsupported
5.description: Discovery of the target was not supported.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The query result is not mapped. See the query_result attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

query_string.caption: HTTP Query String
query_string.description: The query portion of the URL. For example: the query portion of the URL http://www.example.com/search?q=bad&sort=date is q=bad&sort=date.

query_time.caption: Query Time
query_time.description: The Domain Name System (DNS) query time.

query_time_dt.caption: Query Time
query_time_dt.description: The Domain Name System (DNS) query time.

ram_size.caption: RAM Size
ram_size.description: The total amount of installed RAM, in Megabytes. For example: 2048.

rate_limit.caption: Rate Limit
rate_limit.description: The rate limit for a rate-based rule.

raw_data.caption: Raw Data
raw_data.description: The raw event/finding data as received from the source.

rcode.caption: Response Code
rcode.description: The server response code, normalized to the caption of the rcode_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

rcode_id.caption: Response Code ID
rcode_id.description: The normalized identifier of the server response code. See specific usage.

0.caption: Unknown
0.description: The DNS response code is unknown.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The DNS response code is not defined by the RFC. See the rcode attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

rdata.caption: DNS RData
rdata.description: The data describing the DNS resource. The meaning of this data depends on the type and class of the resource record.

references.caption: References
references.description: A list of reference URLs supporting the finding/detection.

referrer.caption: HTTP Referrer
referrer.description: The request header that identifies the address of the previous web page, which is linked to the current web page or resource being requested.

region.caption: Region
region.description: The name or the code of a region. See specific usage.

related_analytics.caption: Related Analytics
related_analytics.description: Describes analytics related to the analytic of a finding or detection as identified by the security product.

related_events.caption: Related Events
related_events.description: Describes events and/or other findings related to the finding as identified by the security product.

related_vulnerabilities.caption: Related Vulnerabilities
related_vulnerabilities.description: List of vulnerabilities that are related to this vulnerability.

relay.caption: Relay
relay.description: The network relay that is associated with the event.

release.caption: Software Release Details
release.description: Release is the number of times a version of the software has been packaged.

remediation.caption: Remediation Guidance
remediation.description: Describes the recommended remediation steps to address identified issue(s).

remote_display.caption: Remote Display
remote_display.description: The remote display affiliated with the event

reply_to.caption: Reply To
reply_to.description: The email header Reply-To values, as defined by RFC 5322.

reputation.caption: Reputation Scores
reputation.description: Contains the original and normalized reputation scores.

request.caption: API Request Details
request.description: General Purpose API Request Object. See specific usage

requested_permissions.caption: Requested Permissions
requested_permissions.description: The permissions mask that were requested by the process.

requirements.caption: Compliance Requirements
requirements.description: A list of requirements associated to a specific control in an industry or regulatory framework. e.g. NIST.800-53.r5 AU-10

resource_type.caption: Resource Type
resource_type.description: The resource type as defined by the event source.

resources.caption: Resources Array
resources.description: Describes details about resources that were affected by the activity/event.

response.caption: API Response Details
response.description: General Purpose API Response Object. See specific usage.

response_time.caption: Response Time
response_time.description: The Domain Name System (DNS) response time.

response_time_dt.caption: Response Time
response_time_dt.description: The Domain Name System (DNS) response time.

risk_details.caption: Risk Details
risk_details.description: Describes the risk associated with the finding.

risk_level.caption: Risk Level
risk_level.description: The risk level, normalized to the caption of the risk_level_id value.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The risk level is not mapped. See the risk_level attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

risk_score.caption: Risk Score
risk_score.description: The risk score as reported by the event source.

rpc_interface.caption: Remote Procedure Call Interface
rpc_interface.description: The RPC Interface object describes the details pertaining to the remote procedure call interface.

rule.caption: Rule
rule.description: The rules that reported the events.

run_state.caption: Run State
run_state.description: The state of the job or service, normalized to the caption of the run_state_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source. See specific usage.

run_state_id.caption: Run State ID
run_state_id.description: The normalized identifier of the state of the job or service. See specific usage.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The run state is not mapped. See the run_state attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

runtime.caption: Runtime
runtime.description: The backend running the container, such as containerd or cri-o.

samesite.caption: SameSite
samesite.description: The cookie attribute that lets servers specify whether/when cookies are sent with cross-site requests. Values are: Strict, Lax or None

sandbox.caption: Sandbox
sandbox.description: The name of the containment jail (i.e., sandbox). For example, hardened_ps, high_security_ps, oracle_ps, netsvcs_ps, or default_ps.

sans.caption: Subject Alternative Names
sans.description: The list of subject alternative names that are secured by a specific certificate.

scale_factor.caption: Scale Factor
scale_factor.description: The numeric scale factor of display.

scan.caption: Scan
scan.description: The Scan object describes characteristics of a scan.  See specific usage.

schedule_uid.caption: Schedule UID
schedule_uid.description: The unique identifier of the schedule associated with a scan job.

scheme.caption: Scheme
scheme.description: The scheme portion of the URL. For example: http, https, ftp, or sftp.

score.caption: Reputation Score
score.description: The reputation score, normalized to the caption of the score_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

1.caption: Very Safe
1.description: Long history of good behavior.

10.caption: Malicious
10.description: Proven evidence of maliciousness.

2.caption: Safe
2.description: Consistently good behavior.

3.caption: Probably Safe
3.description: Reasonable history of good behavior.

4.caption: Leans Safe
4.description: Starting to establish a history of normal behavior.

5.caption: May not be Safe
5.description: No established history of normal behavior.

6.caption: Exercise Caution
6.description: Starting to establish a history of suspicious or risky behavior.

7.caption: Suspicious/Risky
7.description: A site with a history of suspicious or risky behavior. (spam, scam, potentially unwanted software, potentially malicious).

8.caption: Possibly Malicious
8.description: Strong possibility of maliciousness.

9.caption: Probably Malicious
9.description: Indicators of maliciousness.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The reputation score is not mapped. See the rep_score attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

section_a.caption: JA4 Section A
section_a.description: The 'a' section of the JA4 fingerprint.

section_b.caption: JA4 Section B
section_b.description: The 'b' section of the JA4 fingerprint.

section_c.caption: JA4 Section C
section_c.description: The 'c' section of the JA4 fingerprint.

section_d.caption: JA4 Section D
section_d.description: The 'd' section of the JA4 fingerprint.

secure.caption: Secure
secure.description: The cookie attribute to only send cookies to the server with an encrypted request over the HTTPS protocol.

security_level.caption: Security Level
security_level.description: The current security level of the entity

security_level_id.caption: Security Level ID
security_level_id.description: The current security level of the entity

99.caption: Other
99.description: The security level is not mapped. See the security_level attribute, which contains data source specific values.

security_questions.caption: Security Questions
security_questions.description: The question(s) provided to user for a question-based authentication factor.

security_states.caption: Security States
security_states.description: The current security states. See specific usage.

sensitivity.caption: Sensitivity
sensitivity.description: The sensitivity of the firewall rule in the matched event. For example: HIGH.

sequence.caption: Sequence Number
sequence.description: Sequence number of the event. The sequence number is a value available in some events, to make the exact ordering of events unambiguous, regardless of the event time precision.

serial_number.caption: Serial Number
serial_number.description: The serial number that pertains to the object. See specific usage.

server_ciphers.caption: Server Cipher Suites
server_ciphers.description: The server cipher suites that were exchanged during the TLS handshake negotiation.

service.caption: Service
service.description: The service that pertains to the event.

session.caption: Session
session.description: The authenticated user or service session.

severity.caption: Severity
severity.description: The event/finding severity, normalized to the caption of the severity_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the source.

severity_id.caption: Severity ID
severity_id.description:
The normalized identifier of the event/finding severity.

The normalized severity is a measurement the effort and expense required to manage and resolve an event or incident. Smaller numerical values represent lower impact events, and larger numerical values represent higher impact events.

1.caption: Informational
1.description: Informational message. No action required.

2.caption: Low
2.description: The user decides if action is needed.

3.caption: Medium
3.description: Action is required but the situation is not serious at this time.

5.caption: Critical
5.description: Action is required immediately and the scope is broad.

6.caption: Fatal
6.description: An error occurred but it is too late to take remedial action.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The event/finding severity is not mapped. See the severity attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

share.caption: Share
share.description: The share name. See specific usage.

share_type.caption: Share Type
share_type.description: The share type, normalized to the caption of the share_type_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

share_type_id.caption: Share Type Id
share_type_id.description: The normalized identifier of the share type.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The share type is not mapped. See the share_type attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

short_desc.caption: Short Description
short_desc.description: The short description that pertains to the object or event. See specific usage.

signature.caption: Digital Signature
signature.description: The digital signature of the file.

size.caption: Size
size.description: The size of data, in bytes.

smtp_from.caption: SMTP From
smtp_from.description: The value of the SMTP MAIL FROM command.

smtp_hello.caption: SMTP Hello
smtp_hello.description: The value of the SMTP HELO or EHLO command.

smtp_to.caption: SMTP To
smtp_to.description: The value of the SMTP envelope RCPT TO command.

sni.caption: Server Name Indication
sni.description: The Server Name Indication (SNI) extension sent by the client.

sp_name.caption: OS Service Pack
sp_name.description: The name of the latest Service Pack.

sp_ver.caption: OS Service Pack Version
sp_ver.description: The version number of the latest Service Pack.

spf.caption: SPF Status
spf.description: The Sender Policy Framework (SPF) status of the email.

src_endpoint.caption: Source Endpoint
src_endpoint.description: The network source endpoint.

src_url.caption: Source URL
src_url.description: The URL pointing towards the source of an entity. See specific usage.

standards.caption: Security Standards
standards.description: Security standards are a set of criteria organizations can follow to protect sensitive and confidential information. e.g. NIST SP 800-53, CIS AWS Foundations Benchmark v1.4.0, ISO/IEC 27001

start_address.caption: Start Address
start_address.description: The start address of the execution.

start_line.caption: Start Line
start_line.description: The line number of the first line of code block identified as vulnerable.

start_time.caption: Start Time
start_time.description: The start time of a time period. See specific usage.

start_time_dt.caption: Start Time
start_time_dt.description: The start time of a time period. See specific usage.

state.caption: State
state.description: The state of the event or object, normalized to the caption of the state_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source. See specific usage.

state_id.caption: State ID
state_id.description: The normalized state ID of the event or object. See specific usage.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The state is not mapped. See the state attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

status.caption: Status
status.description: The event status, normalized to the caption of the status_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

status_code.caption: Status Code
status_code.description:
The event status code, as reported by the event source.

For example, in a Windows Failed Authentication event, this would be the value of 'Failure Code', e.g. 0x18.

status_detail.caption: Status Detail
status_detail.description: The status detail contains additional information about the event/finding outcome.

status_id.caption: Status ID
status_id.description: The normalized identifier of the event status.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The event status is not mapped. See the status attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

stratum.caption: Stratum
stratum.description: The stratum level of the NTP server's time source, normalized to the caption of the stratum_id value.

stratum_id.caption: Stratum ID
stratum_id.description: The normalized identifier of the stratum level, as defined in RFC-5905.

1.caption: Primary Server
1.description: The highest precision primary server (e.g atomic clock or GPS).

17.caption: Reserved
17.description: Reserved stratum (possible values: 17-255).

2.caption: Secondary Server
2.description: A secondary level server (possible values: 2-15).

99.caption: Other
99.description: The stratum level is not mapped. See the stratum attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

sub_technique.caption: Sub Technique
sub_technique.description: The Sub Technique object describes the sub technique ID and/or name associated to an attack, as defined by ATT&CK Matrix.

subdomain.caption: Subdomain
subdomain.description: The subdomain portion of the URL. For example: sub in https://sub.example.com or sub2.sub1 in https://sub2.sub1.example.com.

subdomains.caption: Subdomains
subdomains.description: An array of subdomain strings. Can be used to collect several subdomains such as those from Domain Generation Algorithms (DGAs).

subject.caption: Subject Details
subject.description: The identifier of the subject. See specific usage.

subnet_prefix.caption: Subnet Prefix Length
subnet_prefix.description: The subnet prefix length determines the number of bits used to represent the network part of the IP address. The remaining bits are reserved for identifying individual hosts within that subnet.

subnet_uid.caption: Subnet UID
subnet_uid.description: The unique identifier of a virtual subnet.

supporting_data.caption: Supporting Data
supporting_data.description: Additional data supporting a finding as provided by security tool

surname.caption: Surname
surname.description: The last or family name for the user.

svc_name.caption: Service Name
svc_name.description: The service name in service-to-service connections. For example, AWS VPC logs the pkt-src-aws-service and pkt-dst-aws-service fields identify the connection is coming from or going to an AWS service.

system_call.caption: System Call
system_call.description: The system call that was invoked.

table.caption: Table
table.description: The table object represents a table within a structured relational database or datastore, which contains columns and rows of data that are able to be create, updated, deleted and queried.

tactic.caption: Tactic
tactic.description: The Tactic object describes the tactic ID and/or name that is associated to an attack, as defined by ATT&CK Matrix.

tactics.caption: Tactics
tactics.description: The Tactic object describes the tactic ID and/or tactic name that are associated with the attack technique, as defined by ATT&CK Matrix.

tcp_flags.caption: TCP Flags
tcp_flags.description: The network connection TCP header flags (i.e., control bits).

technique.caption: Technique
technique.description: The Technique object describes the technique ID and/or name associated to an attack, as defined by ATT&CK Matrix.

terminal.caption: Terminal
terminal.description: The Pseudo Terminal. Ex: the tty or pts value.

terminated_time.caption: Terminated Time
terminated_time.description: The time when the entity was terminated. See specific usage.

terminated_time_dt.caption: Terminated Time
terminated_time_dt.description: The time when the entity was terminated. See specific usage.

ticket.caption: Ticket
ticket.description: The linked ticket in the ticketing system.

tid.caption: Thread ID
tid.description: The Identifier of the thread associated with the event, as returned by the operating system.

time.caption: Event Time
time.description: The normalized event occurrence time or the finding creation time.

time_dt.caption: Event Time
time_dt.description: The normalized event occurrence time or the finding creation time.

timezone_offset.caption: Timezone Offset
timezone_offset.description: The number of minutes that the reported event time is ahead or behind UTC, in the range -1,080 to +1,080.

title.caption: Title
title.description: The title of an entity. See specific usage.

tlp.caption: Traffic Light Protocol
tlp.description: The Traffic Light Protocol was created to facilitate greater sharing of potentially sensitive information and more effective collaboration. TLP provides a simple and intuitive schema for indicating with whom potentially sensitive information can be shared.

to.caption: To
to.description: The email header To values, as defined by RFC 5322.

total.caption: Total
total.description: The total number of items. See specific usage.

traffic.caption: Traffic
traffic.description: The network traffic refers to the amount of data moving across a network at a given point of time. Intended to be used alongside Network Connection.

transaction_uid.caption: Transaction UID
transaction_uid.description: The unique identifier of the transaction.

transmit_time.caption: Transmission Time
transmit_time.description: The event transmission time from one device to another.  See specific usage.

transmit_time_dt.caption: Transmission Time
transmit_time_dt.description: The event transmission time from one device to another.  See specific usage.

tree_uid.caption: Tree UID
tree_uid.description: The tree id is a unique SMB identifier which represents an open connection to a share.

ttl.caption: TTL
ttl.description: The time interval that the resource record may be cached. Zero value means that the resource record can only be used for the transaction in progress, and should not be cached.

tunnel_interface.caption: Interface
tunnel_interface.description: The information about the tunnel interface. See specific usage.

tunnel_type.caption: Type
tunnel_type.description: The tunnel type. See specific usage.

type.caption: Type
type.description: The type of an object or value, normalized to the caption of the type_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source. See specific usage.

type_id.caption: Type ID
type_id.description: The normalized type identifier of an object. See specific usage.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The type is not mapped. See the type attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

type_name.caption: Type Name
type_name.description: The event/finding type name, as defined by the type_uid.

type_uid.caption: Type ID
type_uid.description: The event/finding type ID. It identifies the event's semantics and structure. The value is calculated by the logging system as: class_uid * 100 + activity_id.

types.caption: Types
types.description: The type/s of an entity. See specific usage.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The unique identifier. See specific usage.

uid_alt.caption: Alternate ID
uid_alt.description: The alternate unique identifier. See specific usage.

unmapped.caption: Unmapped Data
unmapped.description: The attributes that are not mapped to the event schema. The names and values of those attributes are specific to the event source.

url.caption: URL
url.description: The URL object that pertains to the event or object. See specific usage.

url_string.caption: URL String
url_string.description: The URL string. See RFC 1738. For example: http://www.example.com/download/trouble.exe.

user.caption: User
user.description: The user that pertains to the event or object.

user_agent.caption: HTTP User-Agent
user_agent.description: The request header that identifies the operating system and web browser.

user_result.caption: User Result
user_result.description: The result of the user account change. It should contain the new values of the changed attributes.

users.caption: Users
users.description: The users that pertain to the event or object.

uuid.caption: UUID
uuid.description: The universally unique identifier. See specific usage.

value.caption: Value
value.description: The value that pertains to the object. See specific usage.

vector_string.caption: Vector String
vector_string.description: The CVSS vector string is a text representation of a set of CVSS metrics. It is commonly used to record or transfer CVSS metric information in a concise form. For example: 3.1/AV:L/AC:L/PR:L/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:N/A:H.

vendor_name.caption: Vendor Name
vendor_name.description: The name of the vendor. See specific usage.

verdict.caption: Verdict
verdict.description: The verdict assigned to an Incident finding.

verdict_id.caption: Verdict ID
verdict_id.description: The normalized verdict of an Incident.

1.caption: False Positive
1.description: The incident is a false positive.

10.caption: Duplicate
10.description: The incident is a duplicate.

2.caption: True Positive
2.description: The incident is a true positive.

3.caption: Disregard
3.description: The incident can be disregarded as it is unimportant, an error or accident.

5.caption: Benign
5.description: The incident is benign.

6.caption: Test
6.description: The incident is a test.

7.caption: Insufficient Data
7.description: The incident has insufficient data to make a verdict.

8.caption: Security Risk
8.description: The incident is a security risk.

9.caption: Managed Externally
9.description: The incident remediation or required actions are managed externally.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The type is not mapped. See the type attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

version.caption: Version
version.description: The version that pertains to the event or object. See specific usage.

vpc_uid.caption: VPC UID
vpc_uid.description: The unique identifier of the Virtual Private Cloud (VPC).

vulnerabilities.caption: Vulnerabilities
vulnerabilities.description: This object describes vulnerabilities reported in a security finding.

vulnerability.caption: Vulnerability
vulnerability.description: The vulnerability object describes details related to the observed vulnerability

web_resources.caption: Web Resources
web_resources.description: Describes details about web resources that were affected by an activity/event.

web_resources_result.caption: Web Resources Result
web_resources_result.description: The results of the activity on web resources. It should contain the new values of the changed attributes of the web resources.

whois.caption: WHOIS
whois.description: The resources of a WHOIS record for a given domain. This can include domain names, IP address blocks, autonomous system information, and/or contact and registration information for a domain.

win/load_order_group.caption: Load Order Group
win/load_order_group.description: The name of the load ordering group of which this service is a member.

win/prev_reg_key.caption: Previous Registry Key
win/prev_reg_key.description: The registry key before the mutation

win/prev_reg_value.caption: Previous Registry Value
win/prev_reg_value.description: The registry value before the mutation

win/reg_key.caption: Registry Key
win/reg_key.description: Describes details about the registry key that triggered the detection.

win/reg_value.caption: Registry Value
win/reg_value.description: Describes details about the registry value that triggered the detection.

win/service_category.caption: Service Category
win/service_category.description: The service category, normalized to the caption of the service_category_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

win/service_category_id.caption: Service Category ID
win/service_category_id.description: The normalized identifier of the service category.

1.caption: Kernel Mode
1.description: A kernel mode driver.

2.caption: User Mode
2.description: A user mode service.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The service category is not mapped. See the service_category attribute, which contains an event source specific value.

win/service_dependencies.caption: Service Dependencies
win/service_dependencies.description: The names of other services upon which this service has a dependency.

win/service_error_control.caption: Service Error Control
win/service_error_control.description: The service error control, normalized to the caption of the service_error_control_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

win/service_error_control_id.caption: Service Error Control ID
win/service_error_control_id.description: The normalized identifier of the service error control.

0.caption: Unknown
0.description: The service error control is unknown.

1.caption: Ignore
1.description: The startup program ignores the error and continues the startup operation.

2.caption: Normal
2.description: The startup program logs the error in the event log but continues the startup operation.

3.caption: Severe
3.description: The startup program logs the error in the event log. If the last-known-good configuration is being started, the startup operation continues. Otherwise, the system is restarted with the last-known-good configuration.

4.caption: Critical
4.description: The startup program logs the error in the event log, if possible. If the last-known-good configuration is being started, the startup operation fails. Otherwise, the system is restarted with the last-known good configuration.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The service error control is not mapped. See the service_error_control attribute, which contains an event source specific value.

win/service_start_name.caption: Service Start Name
win/service_start_name.description: For a user mode service, this attribute represents the name of the account under which the service is run. For a kernel mode driver, this attribute represents the object name used to load the driver.

win/service_start_type.caption: Service Start Type
win/service_start_type.description: The service start type, normalized to the caption of the service_start_type_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

win/service_start_type_id.caption: Service Start Type ID
win/service_start_type_id.description: The normalized identifier of the service start type.

0.caption: Unknown
0.description: The service start type is unknown.

1.caption: Boot
1.description: A kernel mode driver loaded at boot.

2.caption: System
2.description: A kernel mode driver loaded during system startup.

3.caption: Auto
3.description: A user mode service started automatically during system startup.

4.caption: Demand
4.description: A user mode service started on demand when a process calls StartService.

5.caption: Disabled
5.description: A driver or service that cannot be started.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The service start type is not mapped. See the service_start_type attribute, which contains an event source specific value.

win/service_type.caption: Service Type
win/service_type.description: The service type, normalized to the caption of the service_type_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

win/service_type_id.caption: Service Type ID
win/service_type_id.description: The normalized identifier of the service type.

1.caption: Kernel Driver
1.description: A kernel mode driver.

2.caption: File System Driver
2.description: A kernel mode file system minifilter.

3.caption: Own Process
3.description: A user mode service that runs in its own process.

4.caption: Share Process
4.description: A user mode service that shares a process with other services.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The service type is not mapped. See the service_type attribute, which contains an event source specific value.

win/win_resource.caption: Windows Resource
win/win_resource.description: The Windows resource object that was accessed, such as a mutant or timer.

win/win_service.caption: Windows Service
win/win_service.description: Describes details about the Windows service that triggered the detection.

x_forwarded_for.caption: X-Forwarded-For
x_forwarded_for.description: The X-Forwarded-For header identifying the originating IP address(es) of a client connecting to a web server through an HTTP proxy or a load balancer.

x_originating_ip.caption: X-Originating-IP
x_originating_ip.description: The X-Originating-IP header identifying the emails originating IP address(es).

xattributes.caption: Extended Attributes
xattributes.description:
An unordered collection of zero or more name/value pairs where each pair represents a file or folder extended attribute.

For example: Windows alternate data stream attributes (ADS stream name, ADS size, etc.), user-defined or application-defined attributes, ACL, owner, primary group, etc. Examples from DCS:

  • ads_name
  • ads_size
  • dacl
  • owner
  • primary_group
  • link_name - name of the link associated to the file.
  • hard_link_count - the number of links that are associated to the file.

zone.caption: Network Zone
zone.description: The network zone or LAN segment.

labels.caption: Labels
labels.description: The list of labels/tags associated to the account.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The name of the account (e.g. GCP Account Name).

type.caption: Type
type.description: The account type, normalized to the caption of 'account_type_id'. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

type_id.caption: Type ID
type_id.description: The normalized account type identifier.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The account type is not mapped.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The unique identifier of the account (e.g. AWS Account ID).

account.caption: Account
account.description: The Account object contains details about the account that initiated or performed a specific activity within a system or application.
account.name: account

app_name.caption: Application Name
app_name.description: The client application or service that initiated the activity. This can be in conjunction with the user if present. Note that app_name is distinct from the process if present.

app_uid.caption: Application ID
app_uid.description: The unique identifier of the client application or service that initiated the activity. This can be in conjunction with the user if present. Note that app_name is distinct from the process.pid or process.uid if present.

authorizations.caption: Authorization Information
authorizations.description: Provides details about an authorization, such as authorization outcome, and any associated policies related to the activity/event.

idp.caption: Identity Provider
idp.description: This object describes details about the Identity Provider used.

invoked_by.caption: Invoked by
invoked_by.description: The name of the service that invoked the activity as described in the event.

process.caption: Process
process.description: The process that initiated the activity.

session.caption: Session
session.description: The user session from which the activity was initiated.

user.caption: User
user.description: The user that initiated the activity or the user context from which the activity was initiated.

actor.caption: Actor
actor.description: The Actor object contains details about the user, role, application, service, or process that initiated or performed a specific activity.
actor.name: actor

end_line.caption: End Line
end_line.description: The line number of the last line of code block identified as vulnerable.

file.caption: File
file.description: Details about the file that contains the affected code block.

owner.caption: Owner
owner.description: Details about the user that owns the affected file.

remediation.caption: Remediation Guidance
remediation.description: Describes the recommended remediation steps to address identified issue(s).

start_line.caption: Start Line
start_line.description: The line number of the first line of code block identified as vulnerable.

affected_code.caption: Affected Code
affected_code.description: The Affected Code object describes details about a code block identified as vulnerable.
affected_code.name: affected_code

architecture.caption: Architecture
architecture.description: Architecture is a shorthand name describing the type of computer hardware the packaged software is meant to run on.

cpe_name.caption: The product CPE identifier
cpe_name.description: The Common Platform Enumeration (CPE) name as described by (NIST) For example: cpe:/a:apple:safari:16.2.

epoch.caption: Epoch
epoch.description: The software package epoch. Epoch is a way to define weighted dependencies based on version numbers.

fixed_in_version.caption: Fixed In Version
fixed_in_version.description: The software package version in which a reported vulnerability was patched/fixed.

hash.caption: Hash
hash.description: Cryptographic hash to identify the binary instance of a software component. This can include any component such file, package, or library.

license.caption: Software License
license.description: The software license applied to this package.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The software package name.

package_manager.caption: Package Manager
package_manager.description: The software packager manager utilized to manage a package on a system, e.g. npm, yum, dpkg etc.

path.caption: Path
path.description: The installation path of the affected package.

purl.caption: Package URL
purl.description: A purl is a URL string used to identify and locate a software package in a mostly universal and uniform way across programming languages, package managers, packaging conventions, tools, APIs and databases.

release.caption: Software Release Details
release.description: Release is the number of times a version of the software has been packaged.

remediation.caption: Remediation Guidance
remediation.description: Describes the recommended remediation steps to address identified issue(s).

type.caption: Type
type.description: The type of software package, normalized to the caption of the type_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the source.

type_id.caption: Type ID
type_id.description: The type of software package.

1.caption: Application
1.description: An application software package.

2.caption: Operating System
2.description: An operating system software package.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The type is not mapped. See the type attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

vendor_name.caption: Vendor Name
vendor_name.description: The name of the vendor who published the software package.

affected_package.caption: Affected Software Package
affected_package.description: The Affected Package object describes details about a software package identified as affected by a vulnerability/vulnerabilities.
affected_package.name: affected_package

name.caption: Agent Name
name.description: The name of the agent or sensor. For example: AWS SSM Agent.

policies.caption: Agent Policies
policies.description: Describes the various policies that may be applied or enforced by an agent or sensor. E.g., Conditional Access, prevention, auto-update, tamper protection, destination configuration, etc.

type.caption: Agent Type
type.description: The normalized caption of the type_id value for the agent or sensor. In the case of 'Other' or 'Unknown', it is defined by the event source.

type_id.caption: Type ID
type_id.description: The normalized representation of an agent or sensor. E.g., EDR, vulnerability management, APM, backup & recovery, etc.

1.caption: Endpoint Detection and Response
1.description: Any EDR sensor or agent. Or any tool that provides similar threat detection, anti-malware, anti-ransomware, or similar capabilities. E.g., Crowdstrike Falcon, Microsoft Defender for Endpoint, Wazuh.

2.caption: Data Loss Prevention
2.description: Any DLP sensor or agent. Or any tool that provides similar data classification, data loss detection, and/or data loss prevention capabilities. E.g., Forcepoint DLP, Microsoft Purview, Symantec DLP.

3.caption: Backup & Recovery
3.description: Any agent or sensor that provides backups, archival, or recovery capabilities. E.g., Azure Backup, AWS Backint Agent.

4.caption: Performance Monitoring & Observability
4.description: Any agent or sensor that provides Application Performance Monitoring (APM), active tracing, profiling, or other observability use cases and optionally forwards the logs. E.g., New Relic Agent, Datadog Agent, Azure Monitor Agent.

5.caption: Vulnerability Management
5.description: Any agent or sensor that provides vulnerability management or scanning capabilities. E.g., Qualys VMDR, Microsoft Defender for Endpoint, Crowdstrike Spotlight, Amazon Inspector Agent.

6.caption: Log Forwarding
6.description: Any agent or sensor that forwards logs to a 3rd party storage system such as a data lake or SIEM. E.g., Splunk Universal Forwarder, Tenzir, FluentBit, Amazon CloudWatch Agent, Amazon Kinesis Agent.

7.caption: Mobile Device Management
7.description: Any agent or sensor responsible for providing Mobile Device Management (MDM) or Mobile Enterprise Management (MEM) capabilities. E.g., JumpCloud Agent, Esper Agent, Jamf Pro binary.

8.caption: Configuration Management
8.description: Any agent or sensor that provides configuration management of a device, such as scanning for software, license management, or applying configurations. E.g., AWS Systems Manager Agent, Flexera, ServiceNow MID Server.

9.caption: Remote Access
9.description: Any agent or sensor that provides remote access capabilities to a device. E.g., BeyondTrust, Amazon Systems Manager Agent, Verkada Agent.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The type is not mapped. See the type attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

uid.caption: Agent ID
uid.description: The UID of the agent or sensor, sometimes known as a Sensor ID or aid.

uid_alt.caption: Alternate Agent ID
uid_alt.description: An alternative or contextual identifier for the agent or sensor, such as a configuration, organization, or license UID.

vendor_name.caption: Vendor Name
vendor_name.description: The company or author who created the agent or sensor. For example: Crowdstrike.

version.caption: Agent Version
version.description: The semantic version of the agent or sensor, e.g., 7.101.50.0.

agent.caption: Agent
agent.description: An Agent (also known as a Sensor) is typically installed on an Operating System (OS) and serves as a specialized software component that can be designed to monitor, detect, collect, archive, or take action. These activities and possible actions are defined by the upstream system controlling the Agent and its intended purpose. For instance, an Agent can include Endpoint Detection & Response (EDR) agents, backup/disaster recovery sensors, Application Performance Monitoring or profiling sensors, and similar software.
agent.name: agent

desc.caption: Description
desc.description: The description of the analytic that generated the finding.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The name of the analytic that generated the finding.

@deprecated.message: Related Analytics has been decoupled from this object, instead use finding_info.related_analytics.

related_analytics.caption: Related Analytics
related_analytics.description: Other analytics related to this analytic.

type.caption: Type
type.description: The analytic type.

type_id.caption: Type ID
type_id.description: The analytic type ID.

1.caption: Rule
1.description: A Rule in security analytics refers to predefined criteria or conditions set to monitor, alert, or enforce policies, playing a crucial role in access control, threat detection, and regulatory compliance across security systems.

10.caption: Partial Data Match
10.description: Partial Data Match involves identifying instances where segments of sensitive information or patterns match, facilitating nuanced DLP and threat detection without requiring complete data conformity.

11.caption: Indexed Data Match
11.description: Indexed Data Match refers to comparing content against a pre-compiled index of sensitive information to efficiently detect and prevent unauthorized access or breaches, streamlining DLP and compliance efforts.

2.caption: Behavioral
2.description: Behavioral analytics focus on monitoring and analyzing user or system actions to identify deviations from established patterns, aiding in the detection of insider threats, fraud, and advanced persistent threats (APTs).

3.caption: Statistical
3.description: Statistical analytics pertains to analyzing data patterns and anomalies using statistical models to predict, detect, and respond to potential threats, enhancing overall security posture through informed decision-making.

4.caption: Learning (ML/DL)
4.description: Learning (ML/DL) encompasses techniques that can "learn" from known data to create analytics that generalize to new data. There may be a statistical component to these techniques, but it is not a requirement.

5.caption: Fingerprinting
5.description: Fingerprinting is the technique of collecting detailed system data, including software versions and configurations, to enhance threat detection, data loss prevention (DLP), and endpoint detection and response (EDR) capabilities.

6.caption: Tagging
6.description: Tagging refers to the practice of assigning labels or identifiers to data, users, assets, or activities to monitor, control access, and facilitate incident response across various security domains such as DLP and EDR.

7.caption: Keyword Match
7.description: Keyword Match involves scanning content for specific terms to identify sensitive information, potential threats, or policy violations, aiding in DLP and compliance monitoring.

8.caption: Regular Expressions
8.description: Regular Expressions are used to define complex search patterns for identifying, validating, and extracting specific data sets or threats within digital content, enhancing DLP, EDR, and threat detection mechanisms.

9.caption: Exact Data Match
9.description: Exact Data Match is a precise comparison technique used to detect the unauthorized use or exposure of specific, sensitive information, crucial for enforcing DLP policies and protecting against data breaches.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The type is not mapped. See the type attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The unique identifier of the analytic that generated the finding.

analytic.caption: Analytic
analytic.description: The Analytic object contains details about the analytic technique used to analyze and derive insights from the data or information that led to the creation of a finding or conclusion.
analytic.name: analytic

group.caption: Group
group.description: The information pertaining to the API group.

request.caption: API Request Details
request.description: Details pertaining to the API request.

response.caption: API Response Details
response.description: Details pertaining to the API response.

service.caption: Service
service.description: The information pertaining to the API service.

version.caption: Version
version.description: The version of the API service.

api.caption: API
api.description: The API, or Application Programming Interface, object represents  information pertaining to an API request and response.
api.name: api

sub_technique.caption: Sub Technique
sub_technique.description: The Sub Technique object describes the sub technique ID and/or name associated to an attack, as defined by ATT&CK Matrix.

tactic.caption: Tactic
tactic.description: The Tactic object describes the tactic ID and/or name that is associated to an attack, as defined by ATT&CK Matrix.

tactics.caption: Tactics
tactics.description: The Tactic object describes the tactic ID and/or tactic name that are associated with the attack technique, as defined by ATT&CK Matrix.

technique.caption: Technique
technique.description: The Technique object describes the technique ID and/or name associated to an attack, as defined by ATT&CK Matrix.

attack.caption: MITRE ATT&CK
attack.description: The MITRE ATT&CK object describes the tactic, technique & sub-technique associated to an attack as defined in ATT&CK Matrix.
attack.name: attack

device.caption: Device
device.description: Device used to complete an authentication request.

email_addr.caption: Email Address
email_addr.description: The email address used in an email-based authentication factor.

factor_type.caption: Factor Type
factor_type.description: The type of authentication factor used in an authentication attempt.

factor_type_id.caption: Factor Type ID
factor_type_id.description: The normalized identifier for the authentication factor.

1.caption: SMS
1.description: User receives and inputs a code sent to their mobile device via SMS text message.

10.caption: WebAuthn
10.description: Web-based API that enables users to register devices as authentication factors.

11.caption: Password
11.description: The user enters a password that they have previously established.

2.caption: Security Question
2.description: The user responds to a security question as part of a question-based authentication factor

3.caption: Phone Call
3.description: System calls the user's registered phone number and requires the user to answer and provide a response.

4.caption: Biometric
4.description: Devices that verify identity-based on user's physical identifiers, such as fingerprint scanners or retina scanners.

5.caption: Push Notification
5.description: Push notification is sent to user's registered device and requires the user to acknowledge.

6.caption: Hardware Token
6.description: Physical device that generates a code to be used for authentication.

7.caption: OTP
7.description: Application generates a one-time password (OTP) for use in authentication.

8.caption: Email
8.description: A code or link is sent to a user's registered email address.

9.caption: U2F
9.description: Typically involves a hardware token, which the user physically interacts with to authenticate.

is_hotp.caption: HMAC-based One-time Password (HOTP)
is_hotp.description: Whether the authentication factor is an HMAC-based One-time Password (HOTP).

is_totp.caption: Time-based One-time Password (TOTP)
is_totp.description: Whether the authentication factor is a Time-based One-time Password (TOTP).

phone_number.caption: Phone Number
phone_number.description: The phone number used for a telephony-based authentication request.

provider.caption: Provider
provider.description: The name of provider for an authentication factor.

security_questions.caption: Security Questions
security_questions.description: The question(s) provided to user for a question-based authentication factor.

auth_factor.caption: Authentication Factor
auth_factor.description: An Authentication Factor object describes a category of methods used for identity verification in an authentication attempt.
auth_factor.name: auth_factor

policy.caption: Policy
policy.description: Details about the Identity/Access management policies that are applicable.

authorization.caption: Authorization Result
authorization.description: The Authorization Result object provides details about the authorization outcome and associated policies related to activity.
authorization.name: authorization

name.caption: Name
name.description: Organization name for the Autonomous System.

number.caption: Number
number.description: Unique number that the AS is identified by.

autonomous_system.caption: Autonomous System
autonomous_system.description: An autonomous system (AS) is a collection of connected Internet Protocol (IP) routing prefixes under the control of one or more network operators on behalf of a single administrative entity or domain that presents a common, clearly defined routing policy to the internet.
autonomous_system.name: autonomous_system

created_time.caption: Created Time
created_time.description: The time when the certificate was created.

created_time_dt.caption: Created Time
created_time_dt.description: The time when the certificate was created.

expiration_time.caption: Expiration Time
expiration_time.description: The expiration time of the certificate.

expiration_time_dt.caption: Expiration Time
expiration_time_dt.description: The expiration time of the certificate.

fingerprints.caption: Fingerprints
fingerprints.description: The fingerprint list of the certificate.

is_self_signed.caption: Certificate Self-Signed
is_self_signed.description: Denotes whether a digital certificate is self-signed or signed by a known certificate authority (CA).

serial_number.caption: Certificate Serial Number
serial_number.description: The serial number of the certificate used to create the digital signature.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The unique identifier of the certificate.

certificate.caption: Digital Certificate
certificate.description: The Digital Certificate, also known as a Public Key Certificate, object contains information about the ownership and usage of a public key. It serves as a means to establish trust in the authenticity and integrity of the public key and the associated entity. Defined by D3FEND d3f:Certificate.
certificate.name: certificate

cis_controls.caption: CIS Controls
cis_controls.description: The CIS Critical Security Controls is a prioritized set of actions to protect your organization and data from cyber-attack vectors.

desc.caption: Description
desc.description: The CIS Benchmark description. For example: The cramfs filesystem type is a compressed read-only Linux filesystem embedded in small footprint systems. A cramfs image can be used without having to first decompress the image.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The CIS Benchmark name. For example: Ensure mounting of cramfs filesystems is disabled.

cis_benchmark.caption: CIS Benchmark
cis_benchmark.description: The CIS Benchmark object describes best practices for securely configuring IT systems, software, networks, and cloud infrastructure as defined by the Center for Internet Security. See also Getting to Know the CIS Benchmarks.
cis_benchmark.name: cis_benchmark

desc.caption: Description
desc.description: The CIS benchmark description.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The CIS benchmark name.

remediation.caption: Remediation Guidance
remediation.description: Describes the recommended remediation steps to address identified issue(s).

cis_benchmark_result.caption: CIS Benchmark Result
cis_benchmark_result.description: The CIS Benchmark Result object contains information as defined by the Center for Internet Security (CIS) benchmark result. CIS Benchmarks are a collection of best practices for securely configuring IT systems, software, networks, and cloud infrastructure.
cis_benchmark_result.name: cis_benchmark_result

desc.caption: Description
desc.description: The CIS Control description. For example: Uninstall or disable unnecessary services on enterprise assets and software, such as an unused file sharing service, web application module, or service function.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The CIS Control name. For example: 4.8 Uninstall or Disable Unnecessary Services on Enterprise Assets and Software.

version.caption: Version
version.description: The CIS Control version. For example: v8.

cis_control.caption: CIS Control
cis_control.description: The CIS Control (aka Critical Security Control) object describes a prioritized set of actions to protect your organization and data from cyber-attack vectors. The CIS Controls are defined by the Center for Internet Security.
cis_control.name: cis_control

control.caption: Security Control
control.description: A Control is prescriptive, prioritized, and simplified set of best practices that one can use to strengthen their cybersecurity posture. e.g. AWS SecurityHub Controls, CIS Controls.

version.caption: Version
version.description: The CIS critical security control version.

cis_csc.caption: CIS CSC
cis_csc.description: The CIS Critical Security Control (CSC) contains information as defined by the Center for Internet Security Critical Security Control (CIS CSC). Prioritized set of actions to protect your organization and data from cyber-attack vectors.
cis_csc.name: cis_csc

account.caption: Account
account.description: The account object describes details about the account that was the source or target of the activity.

org.caption: Organization
org.description: Organization and org unit relevant to the event or object.

project_uid.caption: Project ID
project_uid.description: The unique identifier of a Cloud project.

provider.caption: Provider
provider.description: The unique name of the Cloud services provider, such as AWS, MS Azure, GCP, etc.

region.caption: Region
region.description: The name of the cloud region, as defined by the cloud provider.

zone.caption: Network Zone
zone.description: The availability zone in the cloud region, as defined by the cloud provider.

cloud.caption: Cloud
cloud.description: The Cloud object contains information about a cloud account such as AWS Account ID, regions, etc.
cloud.name: cloud

compliance_references.caption: Complaince References Articles
compliance_references.description: A list of sources of information or tools that help organizations understand, interpret, and implement compliance standards. They provide guidance, best practices, and examples.

compliance_standards.caption: Compliance Standards Articles
compliance_standards.description: A list of established guidelines or criteria that define specific requirements an organization must follow.

control.caption: Security Control
control.description: A Control is prescriptive, prioritized, and simplified set of best practices that one can use to strengthen their cybersecurity posture. e.g. AWS SecurityHub Controls, CIS Controls.

requirements.caption: Compliance Requirements
requirements.description: A list of requirements associated to a specific control in an industry or regulatory framework. e.g. NIST.800-53.r5 AU-10

standards.caption: Security Standards
standards.description: Security standards are a set of criteria organizations can follow to protect sensitive and confidential information. e.g. NIST SP 800-53, CIS AWS Foundations Benchmark v1.4.0, ISO/IEC 27001

status.caption: Status
status.description: The resultant status of the compliance check normalized to the caption of the status_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

status_code.caption: Status Code
status_code.description: The resultant status code of the compliance check.

status_detail.caption: Status Detail
status_detail.description: The contextual description of the status, status_code values.

status_id.caption: Status ID
status_id.description: The normalized status identifier of the compliance check.

1.caption: Pass
1.description: The compliance check passed for all the evaluated resources.

2.caption: Warning
2.description: The compliance check did not yield a result due to missing information.

3.caption: Fail
3.description: The compliance check failed for at least one of the evaluated resources.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The event status is not mapped. See the status attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

compliance.caption: Compliance
compliance.description: The Compliance object contains information about Industry and Regulatory Framework standards, controls and requirements.
compliance.name: compliance

hash.caption: Hash
hash.description: Commit hash of image created for docker or the SHA256 hash of the container. For example: 13550340a8681c84c861aac2e5b440161c2b33a3e4f302ac680ca5b686de48de.

image.caption: Image
image.description: The container image used as a template to run the container.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The container name.

network_driver.caption: Network Driver
network_driver.description: The network driver used by the container. For example, bridge, overlay, host, none, etc.

orchestrator.caption: Orchestrator
orchestrator.description: The orchestrator managing the container, such as ECS, EKS, K8s, or OpenShift.

pod_uuid.caption: Pod UUID
pod_uuid.description: The unique identifier of the pod (or equivalent) that the container is executing on.

runtime.caption: Runtime
runtime.description: The backend running the container, such as containerd or cri-o.

size.caption: Size
size.description: The size of the container image.

tag.caption: Image Tag
tag.description: The tag used by the container. It can indicate version, format, OS.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The full container unique identifier for this instantiation of the container. For example: ac2ea168264a08f9aaca0dfc82ff3551418dfd22d02b713142a6843caa2f61bf.

container.caption: Container
container.description: The Container object describes an instance of a specific container. A container is a prepackaged, portable system image that runs isolated on an existing system using a container runtime like containerd.
container.name: container

created_time.caption: Created Time
created_time.description: The Record Creation Date identifies when the CVE ID was issued to a CVE Numbering Authority (CNA) or the CVE Record was published on the CVE List. Note that the Record Creation Date does not necessarily indicate when this vulnerability was discovered, shared with the affected vendor, publicly disclosed, or updated in CVE.

created_time_dt.caption: Created Time
created_time_dt.description: The Record Creation Date identifies when the CVE ID was issued to a CVE Numbering Authority (CNA) or the CVE Record was published on the CVE List. Note that the Record Creation Date does not necessarily indicate when this vulnerability was discovered, shared with the affected vendor, publicly disclosed, or updated in CVE.

cvss.caption: CVSS Score
cvss.description: The CVSS object details Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) scores from the advisory that are related to the vulnerability.

cwe.caption: CWE
cwe.description: The CWE object represents a weakness in a software system that can be exploited by a threat actor to perform an attack. The CWE object is based on the Common Weakness Enumeration (CWE) catalog.

@deprecated.message: Use the cwe object attributes instead.

cwe_uid.caption: CWE UID
cwe_uid.description: The Common Weakness Enumeration (CWE) unique identifier. For example: CWE-787.

@deprecated.message: Use the cwe object attributes instead.

cwe_url.caption: CWE URL
cwe_url.description: Common Weakness Enumeration (CWE) definition URL. For example: https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/787.html.

desc.caption: Description
desc.description: A brief description of the CVE Record.

epss.caption: EPSS
epss.description: The Exploit Prediction Scoring System (EPSS) object describes the estimated probability a vulnerability will be exploited. EPSS is a community-driven effort to combine descriptive information about vulnerabilities (CVEs) with evidence of actual exploitation in-the-wild. (EPSS).

modified_time.caption: Modified Time
modified_time.description: The Record Modified Date identifies when the CVE record was last updated.

modified_time_dt.caption: Modified Time
modified_time_dt.description: The Record Modified Date identifies when the CVE record was last updated.

product.caption: Product
product.description: The product where the vulnerability was discovered.

references.caption: References
references.description: A list of reference URLs with additional information about the CVE Record.

title.caption: Title
title.description: A title or a brief phrase summarizing the CVE record.

type.caption: Vulnerability Type
type.description:
The vulnerability type as selected from a large dropdown menu during CVE refinement.

Most frequently used vulnerability types are: DoS, Code Execution, Overflow, Memory Corruption, Sql Injection, XSS, Directory Traversal, Http Response Splitting, Bypass something, Gain Information, Gain Privileges, CSRF, File Inclusion. For more information see Vulnerabilities By Type distributions.

uid.caption: CVE ID
uid.description: The Common Vulnerabilities and Exposures unique number assigned to a specific computer vulnerability. A CVE Identifier begins with 4 digits representing the year followed by a sequence of digits that acts as a unique identifier. For example: CVE-2021-12345.

cve.caption: CVE
cve.description: The Common Vulnerabilities and Exposures (CVE) object represents publicly disclosed cybersecurity vulnerabilities defined in CVE Program catalog (CVE). There is one CVE Record for each vulnerability in the catalog.
cve.name: cve

base_score.caption: Base Score
base_score.description: The CVSS base score. For example: 9.1.

depth.caption: CVSS Depth
depth.description: The CVSS depth represents a depth of the equation used to calculate CVSS score.

metrics.caption: Metrics
metrics.description: The Common Vulnerability Scoring System metrics. This attribute contains information on the CVE's impact. If the CVE has been analyzed, this attribute will contain any CVSSv2 or CVSSv3 information associated with the vulnerability. For example: { {"Access Vector", "Network"}, {"Access Complexity", "Low"}, ...}.

overall_score.caption: Overall Score
overall_score.description: The CVSS overall score, impacted by base, temporal, and environmental metrics. For example: 9.1.

severity.caption: Severity
severity.description:
The Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) Qualitative Severity Rating. A textual representation of the numeric score.

CVSS v2.0
  • Low (0.0 3.9)
  • Medium (4.0 6.9)
  • High (7.0 10.0)

CVSS v3.0
  • None (0.0)
  • Low (0.1 - 3.9)
  • Medium (4.0 - 6.9)
  • High (7.0 - 8.9)
  • Critical (9.0 - 10.0)

vector_string.caption: Vector String
vector_string.description: The CVSS vector string is a text representation of a set of CVSS metrics. It is commonly used to record or transfer CVSS metric information in a concise form. For example: 3.1/AV:L/AC:L/PR:L/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:N/A:H.

cvss.caption: CVSS Score
cvss.description: The Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) object provides a way to capture the principal characteristics of a vulnerability and produce a numerical score reflecting its severity.
cvss.name: cvss

caption.caption: Caption
caption.description: The caption assigned to the Common Weakness Enumeration unique identifier.

src_url.caption: Source URL
src_url.description: URL pointing to the CWE Specification. For more information see CWE.

uid.caption: CWE ID
uid.description: The Common Weakness Enumeration unique number assigned to a specific weakness. A CWE Identifier begins "CWE" followed by a sequence of digits that acts as a unique identifier. For example: CWE-123.

cwe.caption: CWE
cwe.description: The CWE object represents a weakness in a software system that can be exploited by a threat actor to perform an attack. The CWE object is based on the Common Weakness Enumeration (CWE) catalog.
cwe.name: cwe

name.caption: Name
name.description: The tactic name that is associated with the defensive technique, as defined by D3FENDTM Matrix. For example: Isolate.

src_url.caption: Source URL
src_url.description: The versioned permalink of the defensive tactic, as defined by D3FENDTM Matrix. For example: https://d3fend.mitre.org/tactic/d3f:Isolate/.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The unique identifier of the entity.

d3f_tactic.caption: MITRE D3FEND Tactic
d3f_tactic.description: The MITRE D3FEND Tactic object describes the tactic ID and/or name that is associated to an attack, as defined by D3FENDTM Matrix.
d3f_tactic.name: d3f_tactic

name.caption: Name
name.description: The name of the defensive technique, as defined by D3FENDTM Matrix. For example: IO Port Restriction.

src_url.caption: Source URL
src_url.description: The versioned permalink of the defensive technique, as defined by D3FENDTM Matrix. For example: https://d3fend.mitre.org/technique/d3f:IOPortRestriction/.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The unique identifier of the defensive technique, as defined by D3FENDTM Matrix. For example: D3-IOPR.

d3f_technique.caption: MITRE DEFEND Technique
d3f_technique.description: The MITRE DEFEND Technique object describes the leaf defensive technique ID and/or name associated to a countermeasure, as defined by D3FENDTM Matrix.
d3f_technique.name: d3f_technique

d3f_tactic.caption: MITRE DEFEND Tactic
d3f_tactic.description: The Tactic object describes the tactic ID and/or name that is associated with a countermeasure, as defined by D3FEND MatrixTM.

d3f_technique.caption: MITRE DEFEND Technique
d3f_technique.description: The Defend Technique object describes the technique ID and/or name associated with a countermeasure, as defined by D3FEND MatrixTM.

d3fend.caption: MITRE D3FEND
d3fend.description: The MITRE D3FEND object describes the tactic, technique & sub-technique associated with a countermeasure as defined in DEFEND MatrixTM.
d3fend.name: d3fend

category.caption: Category
category.description: The name of the data classification category that data matched into, e.g. Financial, Personal, Governmental, etc.

category_id.caption: Category ID
category_id.description: The normalized identifier of the data classification category.

0.caption: Unknown
0.description: The type is not mapped. See the data_type attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

1.caption: Personal
1.description: Any Personally Identifiable Information (PII), Electronic Personal Health Information (ePHI), or similarly personal information. E.g., full name, home address, date of birth, etc.

2.caption: Governmental
2.description: Any sensitive government identification number related to a person or other classified material. E.g., Passport numbers, driver license numbers, business identification, taxation identifiers, etc.

3.caption: Financial
3.description: Any financially-related sensitive information or Cardholder Data (CHD). E.g., banking account numbers, credit card numbers, International Banking Account Numbers (IBAN), SWIFT codes, etc.

4.caption: Business
4.description: Any business-specific sensitive data such as intellectual property, trademarks, copyrights, human resource data, Board of Directors meeting minutes, and similar.

5.caption: Military and Law Enforcement
5.description: Any mission-specific sensitive data for military, law enforcement, or other government agencies such as specifically classified data, weapon systems information, or other planning data.

6.caption: Security
6.description: Any sensitive security-related data such as passwords, passkeys, IP addresses, API keys, credentials and similar secrets. E.g., AWS Access Secret Key, SaaS API Keys, user passwords, database credentials, etc.

99.caption: Other
99.description: Any other type of data classification or a multi-variate classification made up of several other classification categories.

confidentiality.caption: Confidentiality
confidentiality.description: The file content confidentiality, normalized to the confidentiality_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

confidentiality_id.caption: Confidentiality ID
confidentiality_id.description: The normalized identifier of the file content confidentiality indicator.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The confidentiality is not mapped. See the confidentiality attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

policy.caption: Policy
policy.description: Details about the data policy that governs data handling and security measures related to classification.

data_classification.caption: Data Classification
data_classification.description: The Data Classification object includes information about data classification levels and data category types.
data_classification.name: data_classification

category.caption: Category
category.description: The name of the data classification category that data matched into, e.g. Financial, Personal, Governmental, etc.

category_id.caption: Category ID
category_id.description: The normalized identifier of the data classification category.

0.caption: Unknown
0.description: The type is not mapped. See the data_type attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

1.caption: Personal
1.description: Any Personally Identifiable Information (PII), Electronic Personal Health Information (ePHI), or similarly personal information. E.g., full name, home address, date of birth, etc.

2.caption: Governmental
2.description: Any sensitive government identification number related to a person or other classified material. E.g., Passport numbers, driver license numbers, business identification, taxation identifiers, etc.

3.caption: Financial
3.description: Any financially-related sensitive information or Cardholder Data (CHD). E.g., banking account numbers, credit card numbers, International Banking Account Numbers (IBAN), SWIFT codes, etc.

4.caption: Business
4.description: Any business-specific sensitive data such as intellectual property, trademarks, copyrights, human resource data, Board of Directors meeting minutes, and similar.

5.caption: Military and Law Enforcement
5.description: Any mission-specific sensitive data for military, law enforcement, or other government agencies such as specifically classified data, weapon systems information, or other planning data.

6.caption: Security
6.description: Any sensitive security-related data such as passwords, passkeys, IP addresses, API keys, credentials and similar secrets. E.g., AWS Access Secret Key, SaaS API Keys, user passwords, database credentials, etc.

99.caption: Other
99.description: Any other type of data classification or a multi-variate classification made up of several other classification categories.

confidentiality.caption: Confidentiality
confidentiality.description: The file content confidentiality, normalized to the confidentiality_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

confidentiality_id.caption: Confidentiality ID
confidentiality_id.description: The normalized identifier of the file content confidentiality indicator.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The confidentiality is not mapped. See the confidentiality attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

data_lifecycle_state.caption: Data Lifecycle State
data_lifecycle_state.description: The name of the stage or state that the data was in. E.g., Data-at-Rest, Data-in-Transit, etc.

data_lifecycle_state_id.caption: Data Lifecycle State ID
data_lifecycle_state_id.description: The stage or state that the data was in when it was assessed or scanned by a data security tool.

0.caption: Unknown
0.description: The data lifecycle state is unknown.

1.caption: Data at-Rest
1.description: The data was stored on physical or logcial media and was not actively moving through the network nor was being processed. E.g., data stored in a database, PDF files in a file share, or EHR records in object storage.

2.caption: Data in-Transit
2.description: The data was actively moving through the network or from one physical or logical location to another. E.g., emails being send, data replication or Change Data Capture (CDC) streams, or sensitive data processed on an API.

3.caption: Data in-Use
3.description: The data was being processed, accessed, or read by a system, making it active in memory or CPU. E.g., sensitive data in a Business Intelligence tool, ePHI being processed in an EHR application or a user viewing data stored in a spreadsheet or PDF.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The data lifecycle state is not mapped. See the data_lifecycle_state attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

detection_pattern.caption: Detection Pattern
detection_pattern.description: Specific pattern, algorithm, fingerpint, or model used for detection.

detection_system.caption: Detection System
