protocol_num.description: The TCP/IP protocol number, as defined by the Internet Assigned Numbers Authority (IANA). Use -1 if the protocol is not defined by IANA. See Protocol Numbers. For example: 6 for TCP and 17 for UDP.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The protocol version is not mapped. See the protocol_ver attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

session.caption: Session
session.description: The authenticated user or service session.

tcp_flags.caption: TCP Flags
tcp_flags.description: The network connection TCP header flags (i.e., control bits).

uid.caption: Connection UID
uid.description: The unique identifier of the connection.

network_connection_info.caption: Network Connection Information
network_connection_info.description: The Network Connection Information object describes characteristics of a network connection. Defined by D3FEND d3f:NetworkSession.
network_connection_info.name: network_connection_info

agent_list.caption: Agent List
agent_list.description: A list of agent objects associated with a device, endpoint, or resource.

autonomous_system.caption: Autonomous System
autonomous_system.description: The Autonomous System details associated with an IP address.

container.caption: Container
container.description: The information describing an instance of a container. A container is a prepackaged, portable system image that runs isolated on an existing system using a container runtime like containerd.

hostname.caption: Hostname
hostname.description: The fully qualified name of the endpoint.

instance_uid.caption: Instance ID
instance_uid.description: The unique identifier of a VM instance.

interface_name.caption: Network Interface Name
interface_name.description: The name of the network interface (e.g. eth2).

interface_uid.caption: Network Interface ID
interface_uid.description: The unique identifier of the network interface.

intermediate_ips.caption: Intermediate IP Addresses
intermediate_ips.description: The intermediate IP Addresses. For example, the IP addresses in the HTTP X-Forwarded-For header.

ip.caption: IP Address
ip.description: The IP address of the endpoint, in either IPv4 or IPv6 format.

location.caption: Geo Location
location.description: The geographical location of the endpoint.

mac.caption: MAC Address
mac.description: The Media Access Control (MAC) address of the endpoint.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The short name of the endpoint.

namespace_pid.caption: Namespace PID
namespace_pid.description: If running under a process namespace (such as in a container), the process identifier within that process namespace.

owner.caption: Owner
owner.description: The identity of the service or user account that owns the endpoint or was last logged into it.

port.caption: Port
port.description: The port used for communication within the network connection.

proxy_endpoint.caption: Proxy Endpoint
proxy_endpoint.description: The network proxy information pertaining to a specific endpoint. This can be used to describe information pertaining to network address translation (NAT).

subnet_uid.caption: Subnet UID
subnet_uid.description: The unique identifier of a virtual subnet.

svc_name.caption: Service Name
svc_name.description: The service name in service-to-service connections. For example, AWS VPC logs the pkt-src-aws-service and pkt-dst-aws-service fields identify the connection is coming from or going to an AWS service.

type.caption: Type
type.description: The network endpoint type. For example: unknown, server, desktop, laptop, tablet, mobile, virtual, browser, or other.

type_id.caption: Type ID
type_id.description: The network endpoint type ID.

1.caption: Server
1.description: A server.

10.caption: Switch
10.description: A networking switch.

11.caption: Hub
11.description: A networking hub.

12.caption: Router
12.description: A networking router.

13.caption: IDS
13.description: An intrusion detection system.

14.caption: IPS
14.description: An intrusion prevention system.

15.caption: Load Balancer
15.description: A <a target='_blank' href='https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Load_balancing_(computing)'> Load Balancer device.

2.caption: Desktop
2.description: A desktop computer.

3.caption: Laptop
3.description: A laptop computer.

5.caption: Mobile
5.description: A mobile phone.

6.caption: Virtual
6.description: A virtual machine.

7.caption: IOT
7.description: An IOT (Internet of Things) device.

8.caption: Browser
8.description: A web browser.

9.caption: Firewall
9.description: A networking firewall.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The type is not mapped. See the type attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The unique identifier of the endpoint.

vpc_uid.caption: VPC UID
vpc_uid.description: The unique identifier of the Virtual Private Cloud (VPC).

zone.caption: Network Zone
zone.description: The network zone or LAN segment.

network_endpoint.caption: Network Endpoint
network_endpoint.description: The Network Endpoint object describes characteristics of a network endpoint. These can be a source or destination of a network connection.
network_endpoint.name: network_endpoint

hostname.caption: Hostname
hostname.description: The hostname associated with the network interface.

ip.caption: IP Address
ip.description: The IP address associated with the network interface.

mac.caption: MAC Address
mac.description: The MAC address of the network interface.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The name of the network interface.

namespace.caption: Namespace
namespace.description: The namespace is useful in merger or acquisition situations. For example, when similar entities exist that you need to keep separate.

subnet_prefix.caption: Subnet Prefix Length
subnet_prefix.description: The subnet prefix length determines the number of bits used to represent the network part of the IP address. The remaining bits are reserved for identifying individual hosts within that subnet.

type.caption: Type
type.description: The type of network interface.

type_id.caption: Type ID
type_id.description: The network interface type identifier.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The type is not mapped. See the type attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The unique identifier for the network interface.

network_interface.caption: Network Interface
network_interface.description: The Network Interface object describes the type and associated attributes of a network interface.
network_interface.name: network_interface

agent_list.caption: Agent List
agent_list.description: A list of agent objects associated with a device, endpoint, or resource.

autonomous_system.caption: Autonomous System
autonomous_system.description: The Autonomous System details associated with an IP address.

container.caption: Container
container.description: The information describing an instance of a container. A container is a prepackaged, portable system image that runs isolated on an existing system using a container runtime like containerd.

hostname.caption: Hostname
hostname.description: The fully qualified name of the endpoint.

instance_uid.caption: Instance ID
instance_uid.description: The unique identifier of a VM instance.

interface_name.caption: Network Interface Name
interface_name.description: The name of the network interface (e.g. eth2).

interface_uid.caption: Network Interface ID
interface_uid.description: The unique identifier of the network interface.

intermediate_ips.caption: Intermediate IP Addresses
intermediate_ips.description: The intermediate IP Addresses. For example, the IP addresses in the HTTP X-Forwarded-For header.

ip.caption: IP Address
ip.description: The IP address of the endpoint, in either IPv4 or IPv6 format.

location.caption: Geo Location
location.description: The geographical location of the endpoint.

mac.caption: MAC Address
mac.description: The Media Access Control (MAC) address of the endpoint.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The short name of the endpoint.

namespace_pid.caption: Namespace PID
namespace_pid.description: If running under a process namespace (such as in a container), the process identifier within that process namespace.

owner.caption: Owner
owner.description: The identity of the service or user account that owns the endpoint or was last logged into it.

port.caption: Port
port.description: The port used for communication within the network connection.

proxy_endpoint.caption: Proxy Endpoint
proxy_endpoint.description: The network proxy information pertaining to a specific endpoint. This can be used to describe information pertaining to network address translation (NAT).

subnet_uid.caption: Subnet UID
subnet_uid.description: The unique identifier of a virtual subnet.

svc_name.caption: Service Name
svc_name.description: The service name in service-to-service connections. For example, AWS VPC logs the pkt-src-aws-service and pkt-dst-aws-service fields identify the connection is coming from or going to an AWS service.

type.caption: Type
type.description: The network endpoint type. For example: unknown, server, desktop, laptop, tablet, mobile, virtual, browser, or other.

type_id.caption: Type ID
type_id.description: The network endpoint type ID.

1.caption: Server
1.description: A server.

10.caption: Switch
10.description: A networking switch.

11.caption: Hub
11.description: A networking hub.

12.caption: Router
12.description: A networking router.

13.caption: IDS
13.description: An intrusion detection system.

14.caption: IPS
14.description: An intrusion prevention system.

15.caption: Load Balancer
15.description: A <a target='_blank' href='https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Load_balancing_(computing)'> Load Balancer device.

2.caption: Desktop
2.description: A desktop computer.

3.caption: Laptop
3.description: A laptop computer.

5.caption: Mobile
5.description: A mobile phone.

6.caption: Virtual
6.description: A virtual machine.

7.caption: IOT
7.description: An IOT (Internet of Things) device.

8.caption: Browser
8.description: A web browser.

9.caption: Firewall
9.description: A networking firewall.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The type is not mapped. See the type attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The unique identifier of the endpoint.

vpc_uid.caption: VPC UID
vpc_uid.description: The unique identifier of the Virtual Private Cloud (VPC).

zone.caption: Network Zone
zone.description: The network zone or LAN segment.

network_proxy.caption: Network Proxy Endpoint
network_proxy.description: The network proxy endpoint object describes a proxy server, which acts as an intermediary between a client requesting a resource and the server providing that resource. Defined by D3FEND d3f:ProxyServer.
network_proxy.name: network_proxy

bytes.caption: Total Bytes
bytes.description: The total number of bytes (in and out).

bytes_in.caption: Bytes In
bytes_in.description: The number of bytes sent from the destination to the source.

bytes_out.caption: Bytes Out
bytes_out.description: The number of bytes sent from the source to the destination.

chunks.caption: Chunks
chunks.description: The total number of chunks (in and out).

chunks_in.caption: Chunks In
chunks_in.description: The number of chunks sent from the destination to the source.

chunks_out.caption: Chunks Out
chunks_out.description: The number of chunks sent from the source to the destination.

packets.caption: Total Packets
packets.description: The total number of packets (in and out).

packets_in.caption: Packets In
packets_in.description: The number of packets sent from the destination to the source.

packets_out.caption: Packets Out
packets_out.description: The number of packets sent from the source to the destination.

network_traffic.caption: Network Traffic
network_traffic.description: The Network Traffic object describes characteristics of network traffic. Network traffic refers to data moving across a network at a given point of time. Defined by D3FEND d3f:NetworkTraffic.
network_traffic.name: network_traffic

object.caption: Object
object.description: An unordered collection of attributes. It defines a set of attributes available in all objects. It can be also used as a generic object to log objects that are not otherwise defined by the schema.
object.name: object

name.caption: Name
name.description: The full name of the observable attribute. The name is a pointer/reference to an attribute within the event data. For example: file.name.

reputation.caption: Reputation Scores
reputation.description: Contains the original and normalized reputation scores.

type.caption: Type
type.description: The observable value type name.

type_id.caption: Type ID
type_id.description: The observable value type identifier.

1.caption: Hostname
1.description:
Observable by Dictionary Type.
Unique name assigned to a device connected to a computer network. A domain name in general is an Internet address that can be resolved through the Domain Name System (DNS). For example: r2-d2.example.com.

10.caption: Resource UID
10.description:
Observable by Dictionary Type.
Resource unique identifier. For example, S3 Bucket name or EC2 Instance ID.

11.caption: Port
11.description:
Observable by Dictionary Type.
The TCP/UDP port number. For example: 80 or 22.

12.caption: Subnet
12.description:
Observable by Dictionary Type.
The subnet represented in a CIDR notation, using the format network_address/prefix_length. The network_address can be in either IPv4 or IPv6 format. The prefix length indicates the number of bits used for the network portion, and the remaining bits are available for host addresses within that subnet.
For example:
  • 192.168.1.0/24
  • 2001:0db8:85a3:0000::/64

13.caption: Command Line
13.description:
Observable by Dictionary Attribute.
The full command line used to launch an application, service, process, or job. For example: ssh user@10.0.0.10. If the command line is unavailable or missing, the empty string '' is to be used.

14.caption: Country
14.description:
Observable by Dictionary Attribute.
The ISO 3166-1 Alpha-2 country code. For the complete list of country codes see ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 codes.

Note: The two letter country code should be capitalized. For example: US or CA.

15.caption: Process ID
15.description:
Observable by Dictionary Attribute.
The process identifier, as reported by the operating system. Process ID (PID) is a number used by the operating system to uniquely identify an active process.

16.caption: HTTP User-Agent
16.description:
Observable by Dictionary Attribute.
The request header that identifies the operating system and web browser.

17.caption: CWE Object: uid
17.description:
Observable by Object-Specific Attribute.
Object-specific attribute "uid" for the CWE Object.

18.caption: CVE Object: uid
18.description:
Observable by Object-Specific Attribute.
Object-specific attribute "uid" for the CVE Object.

19.caption: User Credential ID
19.description:
Observable by Dictionary Attribute.
The unique identifier of the user's credential. For example, AWS Access Key ID.

2.caption: IP Address
2.description:
Observable by Dictionary Type.
Internet Protocol address (IP address), in either IPv4 or IPv6 format. For example, 192.168.200.24 or 2001:0db8:85a3:0000:0000:8a2e:0370:7334.

20.caption: Endpoint
20.description:
Observable by Object.
The Endpoint object describes a physical or virtual device that connects to and exchanges information with a computer network. Some examples of endpoints are mobile devices, desktop computers, virtual machines, embedded devices, and servers. Internet-of-Things deviceslike cameras, lighting, refrigerators, security systems, smart speakers, and thermostatsare also endpoints.

21.caption: User
21.description:
Observable by Object.
The User object describes the characteristics of a user/person or a security principal. Defined by D3FEND d3f:UserAccount.

22.caption: Email
22.description:
Observable by Object.
The Email object describes the email metadata such as sender, recipients, and direction. Defined by D3FEND d3f:Email.

23.caption: Uniform Resource Locator
23.description:
Observable by Object.
The Uniform Resource Locator(URL) object describes the characteristics of a URL. Defined in RFC 1738 and by D3FEND d3f:URL.

24.caption: File
24.description:
Observable by Object.
The File object represents the metadata associated with a file stored in a computer system. It encompasses information about the file itself, including its attributes, properties, and organizational details. Defined by D3FEND d3f:File.

25.caption: Process
25.description:
Observable by Object.
The Process object describes a running instance of a launched program. Defined by D3FEND d3f:Process.

26.caption: Geo Location
26.description:
Observable by Object.
The Geo Location object describes a geographical location, usually associated with an IP address. Defined by D3FEND d3f:PhysicalLocation.

27.caption: Container
27.description:
Observable by Object.
The Container object describes an instance of a specific container. A container is a prepackaged, portable system image that runs isolated on an existing system using a container runtime like containerd.

28.caption: Registry Key
28.description:
Observable by Object.
The registry key object describes a Windows registry key. Defined by D3FEND d3f:WindowsRegistryKey.

29.caption: Registry Value
29.description:
Observable by Object.
The registry value object describes a Windows registry value.

3.caption: MAC Address
3.description:
Observable by Dictionary Type.
Media Access Control (MAC) address. For example: 18:36:F3:98:4F:9A.

30.caption: Fingerprint
30.description:
Observable by Object.
The Fingerprint object provides detailed information about a digital fingerprint, which is a compact representation of data used to identify a longer piece of information, such as a public key or file content. It contains the algorithm and value of the fingerprint, enabling efficient and reliable identification of the associated data.

4.caption: User Name
4.description:
Observable by Dictionary Type.
User name. For example: john_doe.

5.caption: Email Address
5.description:
Observable by Dictionary Type.
Email address. For example: john_doe@example.com.

6.caption: URL String
6.description:
Observable by Dictionary Type.
Uniform Resource Locator (URL) string. For example: http://www.example.com/download/trouble.exe.

7.caption: File Name
7.description:
Observable by Dictionary Type.
File name. For example: text-file.txt.

8.caption: Hash
8.description:
Observable by Dictionary Type.
Hash. A unique value that corresponds to the content of the file, image, ja3_hash or hassh found in the schema. For example MD5: 3172ac7e2b55cbb81f04a6e65855a628.

9.caption: Process Name
9.description:
Observable by Dictionary Type.
Process name. For example: Notepad.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The observable data type is not mapped. See the type attribute, which may contain data source specific value.

value.caption: Value
value.description:
The value associated with the observable attribute. The meaning of the value depends on the observable type.
If the name refers to a scalar attribute, then the value is the value of the attribute.
If the name refers to an object attribute, then the value is not populated.

observable.caption: Observable
observable.description: The observable object is a pivot element that contains related information found in many places in the event.
observable.name: observable

name.caption: Name
name.description: The name of the organization. For example, Widget, Inc.

ou_name.caption: Org Unit Name
ou_name.description: The name of the organizational unit, within an organization.  For example, Finance, IT, R&D

ou_uid.caption: Org Unit ID
ou_uid.description: The alternate identifier for an entity's unique identifier. For example, its Active Directory OU DN or AWS OU ID.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The unique identifier of the organization. For example, its Active Directory or AWS Org ID.

organization.caption: Organization
organization.description: The Organization object describes characteristics of an organization or company and its division if any.
organization.name: organization

country.caption: Country
country.description: The operating system country code, as defined by the ISO 3166-1 standard (Alpha-2 code). For the complete list of country codes, see ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 codes.

cpe_name.caption: The product CPE identifier
cpe_name.description: The Common Platform Enumeration (CPE) name as described by (NIST) For example: cpe:/a:apple:safari:16.2.

cpu_bits.caption: CPU Bits
cpu_bits.description: The cpu architecture, the number of bits used for addressing in memory. For example: 32 or 64.

edition.caption: OS Edition
edition.description: The operating system edition. For example: Professional.

lang.caption: Language
lang.description: The two letter lower case language codes, as defined by ISO 639-1. For example: en (English), de (German), or fr (French).

name.caption: Name
name.description: The operating system name.

sp_name.caption: OS Service Pack
sp_name.description: The name of the latest Service Pack.

sp_ver.caption: OS Service Pack Version
sp_ver.description: The version number of the latest Service Pack.

type.caption: Type
type.description: The type of the operating system.

type_id.caption: Type ID
type_id.description: The type identifier of the operating system.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The type is not mapped. See the type attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

version.caption: Version
version.description: The version of the OS running on the device that originated the event. For example: "Windows 10", "OS X 10.7", or "iOS 9".

os.caption: Operating System (OS)
os.description: The Operating System (OS) object describes characteristics of an OS, such as Linux or Windows. Defined by D3FEND d3f:OperatingSystem.
os.name: os

answers.caption: Related DNS Answers
answers.description: Any pertinent DNS answers information related to an indicator or OSINT analysis.

attacks.caption: MITRE ATT&CK Details
attacks.description: MITRE ATT&CK Tactics, Techniques, and/or Procedures (TTPs) pertinent to an indicator or OSINT analysis.

autonomous_system.caption: Autonomous System
autonomous_system.description: Any pertinent autonomous system information related to an indicator or OSINT analysis.

comment.caption: Analyst Comments
comment.description: Analyst commentary or source commentary about an indicator or OSINT analysis.

confidence.caption: Confidence
confidence.description: The confidence of an indicator being malicious and/or pertinent, normalized to the caption of the confidence_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source or analyst.

confidence_id.caption: Confidence Id
confidence_id.description: The normalized confidence refers to the accuracy of collected information related to the OSINT or how pertinent an indicator or analysis is to a specific event or finding. A low confidence means that the information collected or analysis conducted lacked detail or is not accurate enough to qualify an indicator as fully malicious.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The confidence is not mapped to the defined enum values. See the confidence attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

email.caption: Related Email
email.description: Any email information pertinent to an indicator or OSINT analysis.

email_auth.caption: Related Email Authentication
email_auth.description: Any email authentication information pertinent to an indicator or OSINT analysis.

kill_chain.caption: Kill Chain
kill_chain.description: Lockheed Martin Kill Chain Phases pertinent to an indicator or OSINT analysis.

location.caption: Geo Location
location.description: Any pertinent geolocation information related to an indicator or OSINT analysis.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The name of the entity.

signatures.caption: Related Digital Signatures
signatures.description: Any digital signatures or hashes related to an indicator or OSINT analysis.

src_url.caption: Source URL
src_url.description: The source URL of an indicator or OSINT analysis, e.g., a URL back to a TIP, report, or otherwise.

subdomains.caption: Related Subdomains
subdomains.description: Any pertinent subdomain information - such as those generated by a Domain Generation Algorithm - related to an indicator or OSINT analysis.

tlp.caption: Traffic Light Protocol
tlp.description: The Traffic Light Protocol was created to facilitate greater sharing of potentially sensitive information and more effective collaboration. TLP provides a simple and intuitive schema for indicating with whom potentially sensitive information can be shared.

AMBER.caption: TLP:AMBER
AMBER.description: TLP:AMBER is for limited disclosure, recipients can only spread this on a need-to-know basis within their organization and its clients. Note that TLP:AMBER+STRICT restricts sharing to the organization only. Sources may use TLP:AMBER when information requires support to be effectively acted upon, yet carries risk to privacy, reputation, or operations if shared outside of the organizations involved. Recipients may share TLP:AMBER information with members of their own organization and its clients, but only on a need-to-know basis to protect their organization and its clients and prevent further harm. Note: if the source wants to restrict sharing to the organization only, they must specify TLP:AMBER+STRICT.

AMBER STRICT.caption: TLP:AMBER+STRICT
AMBER STRICT.description: TLP:AMBER is for limited disclosure, recipients can only spread this on a need-to-know basis within their organization and its clients. Note that TLP:AMBER+STRICT restricts sharing to the organization only. Sources may use TLP:AMBER when information requires support to be effectively acted upon, yet carries risk to privacy, reputation, or operations if shared outside of the organizations involved. Recipients may share TLP:AMBER information with members of their own organization and its clients, but only on a need-to-know basis to protect their organization and its clients and prevent further harm. Note: if the source wants to restrict sharing to the organization only, they must specify TLP:AMBER+STRICT.

CLEAR.caption: TLP:CLEAR
CLEAR.description: TLP:CLEAR denotes that recipients can spread this to the world, there is no limit on disclosure. Sources may use TLP:CLEAR when information carries minimal or no foreseeable risk of misuse, in accordance with applicable rules and procedures for public release. Subject to standard copyright rules, TLP:CLEAR information may be shared without restriction.

GREEN.caption: TLP:GREEN
GREEN.description: TLP:GREEN is for limited disclosure, recipients can spread this within their community. Sources may use TLP:GREEN when information is useful to increase awareness within their wider community. Recipients may share TLP:GREEN information with peers and partner organizations within their community, but not via publicly accessible channels. TLP:GREEN information may not be shared outside of the community. Note: when community is not defined, assume the cybersecurity/defense community.

RED.caption: TLP:RED
RED.description: TLP:RED is for the eyes and ears of individual recipients only, no further disclosure. Sources may use TLP:RED when information cannot be effectively acted upon without significant risk for the privacy, reputation, or operations of the organizations involved. Recipients may therefore not share TLP:RED information with anyone else. In the context of a meeting, for example, TLP:RED information is limited to those present at the meeting.

type.caption: Type
type.description: The OSINT indicator type.

type_id.caption: Indicator Type ID
type_id.description: The OSINT indicator type ID.

0.caption: Unknown
0.description: The indicator type is ambiguous or there is not a related indicator for the OSINT object.

1.caption: IP Address
1.description: An IPv4 or IPv6 address.

10.caption: Vulnerability
10.description: A CVE ID, CWE ID, or other identifier for a weakness, exploit, bug, or misconfiguration.

2.caption: Domain
2.description: A full-qualified domain name (FQDN), subdomain, or partial domain.

3.caption: Hostname
3.description: A hostname or computer name.

4.caption: Hash
4.description: Any type of hash e.g., MD5, SHA1, SHA2, BLAKE, BLAKE2, etc. generated from a file, malware sample, request header, or otherwise.

5.caption: URL
5.description: A Uniform Resource Locator (URL) or Uniform Resource Indicator (URI).

6.caption: User Agent
6.description: A User Agent typically seen in HTTP request headers.

7.caption: Digital Certificate
7.description: The serial number, fingerprint, or full content of an X.509 digital certificate.

8.caption: Email
8.description: The contents of an email or any related information to an email object.

9.caption: Email Address
9.description: An email address.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The indicator type is not directly listed.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The unique identifier of the entity.

value.caption: Indicator
value.description: The actual indicator value in scope, e.g., a SHA-256 hash hexdigest or a domain name.

vendor_name.caption: Vendor Name
vendor_name.description: The vendor name of a tool which generates intelligence or provides indicators.

vulnerabilities.caption: Related Vulnerabilities
vulnerabilities.description: Any vulnerabilities related to an indicator or OSINT analysis.

whois.caption: WHOIS
whois.description: Any pertinent WHOIS information related to an indicator or OSINT analysis.

osint.caption: OSINT
osint.description: The OSINT (Open Source Intelligence) object contains details related to an indicator such as the indicator itself, related indicators, geolocation, registrar information, subdomains, analyst commentary, and other contextual information. This information can be used to further enrich a detection or finding by providing decisioning support to other analysts and engineers.
osint.name: osint

architecture.caption: Architecture
architecture.description: Architecture is a shorthand name describing the type of computer hardware the packaged software is meant to run on.

cpe_name.caption: The product CPE identifier
cpe_name.description: The Common Platform Enumeration (CPE) name as described by (NIST) For example: cpe:/a:apple:safari:16.2.

epoch.caption: Epoch
epoch.description: The software package epoch. Epoch is a way to define weighted dependencies based on version numbers.

hash.caption: Hash
hash.description: Cryptographic hash to identify the binary instance of a software component. This can include any component such file, package, or library.

license.caption: Software License
license.description: The software license applied to this package.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The software package name.

purl.caption: Package URL
purl.description: A purl is a URL string used to identify and locate a software package in a mostly universal and uniform way across programming languages, package managers, packaging conventions, tools, APIs and databases.

release.caption: Software Release Details
release.description: Release is the number of times a version of the software has been packaged.

type.caption: Type
type.description: The type of software package, normalized to the caption of the type_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the source.

type_id.caption: Type ID
type_id.description: The type of software package.

1.caption: Application
1.description: An application software package.

2.caption: Operating System
2.description: An operating system software package.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The type is not mapped. See the type attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

vendor_name.caption: Vendor Name
vendor_name.description: The name of the vendor who published the software package.

package.caption: Software Package
package.description: The Software Package object describes details about a software package. Defined by D3FEND d3f:SoftwarePackage.
package.name: package

class.caption: Class
class.description: The class of the peripheral device.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The name of the peripheral device.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The unique identifier of the peripheral device.

peripheral_device.caption: Peripheral Device
peripheral_device.description: The peripheral device object describes the identity, vendor and model of a peripheral device.
peripheral_device.name: peripheral_device

desc.caption: Description
desc.description: The description of the policy.

is_applied.caption: Applied
is_applied.description: A determination if the content of a policy was applied to a target or request, or not.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The policy name. For example: IAM Policy.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: A unique identifier of the policy instance.

policy.caption: Policy
policy.description:
The Policy object describes the policies that are applicable.

Policy attributes provide traceability to the operational state of the security product at the time that the event was captured, facilitating forensics, troubleshooting, and policy tuning/adjustments.
policy.name: policy

auid.caption: Audit User ID
auid.description: The audit user assigned at login by the audit subsystem.

cmd_line.caption: Command Line
cmd_line.description: The full command line used to launch an application, service, process, or job. For example: ssh user@10.0.0.10. If the command line is unavailable or missing, the empty string '' is to be used.

container.caption: Container
container.description: The information describing an instance of a container. A container is a prepackaged, portable system image that runs isolated on an existing system using a container runtime like containerd.

created_time.caption: Created Time
created_time.description: The time when the process was created/started.

created_time_dt.caption: Created Time
created_time_dt.description: The time when the process was created/started.

egid.caption: Effective Group ID
egid.description: The effective group under which this process is running.

euid.caption: Effective User ID
euid.description: The effective user under which this process is running.

file.caption: File
file.description: The process file object.

group.caption: Group
group.description: The group under which this process is running.

integrity.caption: Integrity
integrity.description: The process integrity level, normalized to the caption of the integrity_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source (Windows only).

integrity_id.caption: Integrity Level
integrity_id.description: The normalized identifier of the process integrity level (Windows only).

99.caption: Other
99.description: The integrity level is not mapped. See the integrity attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

lineage.caption: Lineage
lineage.description: The lineage of the process, represented by a list of paths for each ancestor process. For example: ['/usr/sbin/sshd', '/usr/bin/bash', '/usr/bin/whoami'].

loaded_modules.caption: Loaded Modules
loaded_modules.description: The list of loaded module names.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The friendly name of the process, for example: Notepad++.

namespace_pid.caption: Namespace PID
namespace_pid.description: If running under a process namespace (such as in a container), the process identifier within that process namespace.

parent_process.caption: Parent Process
parent_process.description: The parent process of this process object. It is recommended to only populate this field for the first process object, to prevent deep nesting.

pid.caption: Process ID
pid.description: The process identifier, as reported by the operating system. Process ID (PID) is a number used by the operating system to uniquely identify an active process.

sandbox.caption: Sandbox
sandbox.description: The name of the containment jail (i.e., sandbox). For example, hardened_ps, high_security_ps, oracle_ps, netsvcs_ps, or default_ps.

session.caption: Session
session.description: The user session under which this process is running.

terminated_time.caption: Terminated Time
terminated_time.description: The time when the process was terminated.

terminated_time_dt.caption: Terminated Time
terminated_time_dt.description: The time when the process was terminated.

tid.caption: Thread ID
tid.description: The Identifier of the thread associated with the event, as returned by the operating system.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: A unique identifier for this process assigned by the producer (tool).  Facilitates correlation of a process event with other events for that process.

user.caption: User
user.description: The user under which this process is running.

xattributes.caption: Extended Attributes
xattributes.description: An unordered collection of zero or more name/value pairs that represent a process extended attribute.

process.caption: Process
process.description: The Process object describes a running instance of a launched program. Defined by D3FEND d3f:Process.
process.name: process

cpe_name.caption: The product CPE identifier
cpe_name.description: The Common Platform Enumeration (CPE) name as described by (NIST) For example: cpe:/a:apple:safari:16.2.

data_classification.caption: Data Classification
data_classification.description: The Data Classification object includes information about data classification levels and data category types.

feature.caption: Feature
feature.description: The feature that reported the event.

lang.caption: Language
lang.description: The two letter lower case language codes, as defined by ISO 639-1. For example: en (English), de (German), or fr (French).

name.caption: Name
name.description: The name of the product.

path.caption: Path
path.description: The installation path of the product.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The unique identifier of the product.

url_string.caption: URL String

1.description: Long history of good behavior.

10.caption: Malicious
10.description: Proven evidence of maliciousness.

2.caption: Safe
2.description: Consistently good behavior.

3.caption: Probably Safe

5.caption: May not be Safe

9.caption: Probably Malicious
9.description: Indicators of maliciousness.

last_seen_time_dt.description: The time when the vulnerability was most recently observed.

packages.caption: Software Packages
packages.description: List of vulnerable packages as identified by the security product

references.caption: References
references.description: A list of reference URLs with additional information about the vulnerability.

related_vulnerabilities.caption: Related Vulnerabilities
related_vulnerabilities.description: List of vulnerabilities that are related to this vulnerability.

remediation.caption: Remediation Guidance
remediation.description: The remediation recommendations on how to mitigate the identified vulnerability.

severity.caption: Severity
severity.description: The vendor assigned severity of the vulnerability.

title.caption: Title
title.description: A title or a brief phrase summarizing the discovered vulnerability.

vendor_name.caption: Vendor Name
vendor_name.description: The name of the vendor that identified the vulnerability.

vulnerability.caption: Vulnerability Details
vulnerability.description: The vulnerability is an unintended characteristic of a computing component or system configuration that multiplies the risk of an adverse event or a loss occurring either due to accidental exposure, deliberate attack, or conflict with new system components.
vulnerability.name: vulnerability

data.caption: Data
data.description: Details of the web resource, e.g, file details, search results or application-defined resource.

data_classification.caption: Data Classification
data_classification.description: The Data Classification object includes information about data classification levels and data category types.

desc.caption: Description
desc.description: Description of the web resource.

labels.caption: Labels
labels.description: The list of labels/tags associated to a resource.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The name of the web resource.

type.caption: Type
type.description: The web resource type as defined by the event source.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The unique identifier of the web resource.

url_string.caption: URL String
url_string.description: The URL pointing towards the source of the web resource.

web_resource.caption: Web Resource
web_resource.description: The Web Resource object describes characteristics of a web resource that was affected by the activity/event.
web_resource.name: web_resource

autonomous_system.caption: Autonomous System
autonomous_system.description: The autonomous system information associated with a domain.

created_time.caption: Registered At
created_time.description: When the domain was registered or WHOIS entry was created.

created_time_dt.caption: Registered At
created_time_dt.description: When the domain was registered or WHOIS entry was created.

dnssec_status_id.caption: DNSSEC Status ID
dnssec_status_id.description: Describes the normalized status of DNS Security Extensions (DNSSEC) for a domain.

1.caption: Signed
1.description: The related domain enables the signing of DNS records using DNSSEC.

2.caption: Unsigned
2.description: The related domain does not enable the signing of DNS records using DNSSEC.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The DNSSEC status is not mapped. See the dnssec_status attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

email_addr.caption: Registrar Abuse Email Address
email_addr.description: The email address for the registrar's abuse contact

last_seen_time.caption: Last Updated At
last_seen_time.description: When the WHOIS record was last updated or seen at.

last_seen_time_dt.caption: Last Updated At
last_seen_time_dt.description: When the WHOIS record was last updated or seen at.

name_servers.caption: Name Servers
name_servers.description: A collection of name servers related to a domain registration or other record.

phone_number.caption: Registrar Abuse Phone Number
phone_number.description: The phone number for the registrar's abuse contact

status.caption: Domain Status
status.description: The status of a domain and its ability to be transferred, e.g., clientTransferProhibited.

subdomains.caption: Subdomains
subdomains.description: An array of subdomain strings. Can be used to collect several subdomains such as those from Domain Generation Algorithms (DGAs).

subnet.caption: Subnet Block
subnet.description: The IP address block (CIDR) associated with a domain.

whois.caption: WHOIS
whois.description: The resources of a WHOIS record for a given domain. This can include domain names, IP address blocks, autonomous system information, and/or contact and registration information for a domain.
whois.name: whois

is_system.caption: System
is_system.description: The indication of whether the object is part of the operating system.

modified_time.caption: Modified Time
modified_time.description: The time when the registry key was last modified.

modified_time_dt.caption: Modified Time
modified_time_dt.description: The time when the registry key was last modified.

path.caption: Path
path.description: The full path to the registry key.

security_descriptor.caption: Security Descriptor
security_descriptor.description: The security descriptor of the registry key.

win/reg_key.caption: Registry Key
win/reg_key.description: The registry key object describes a Windows registry key. Defined by D3FEND d3f:WindowsRegistryKey.
win/reg_key.name: reg_key

data.caption: Data
data.description: The data of the registry value.

is_default.caption: Default Value
is_default.description: The indication of whether the value is from a default value name. For example, the value name could be missing.

is_system.caption: System
is_system.description: The indication of whether the object is part of the operating system.

modified_time.caption: Modified Time
modified_time.description: The time when the registry value was last modified.

modified_time_dt.caption: Modified Time
modified_time_dt.description: The time when the registry value was last modified.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The name of the registry value.

path.caption: Path
path.description: The full path to the registry key, where the value is located.

type.caption: Type
type.description: A string representation of the value type as specified in Registry Value Types.

type_id.caption: Type ID
type_id.description: The value type ID.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The type is not mapped. See the type attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

win/reg_value.caption: Registry Value
win/reg_value.description: The registry value object describes a Windows registry value.
win/reg_value.name: reg_value

data_classification.caption: Data Classification
data_classification.description: The Data Classification object includes information about data classification levels and data category types.

details.caption: Details
details.description: The string detailing the attributes of the resource object.

labels.caption: Labels
labels.description: The list of labels/tags associated to a resource.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The name of the resource object.

svc_name.caption: Service Name
svc_name.description: The Windows service acting as the object server for the resource object, such as Security or Security Account Manager.

type.caption: Type
type.description: The type of the Windows resource object.

type_id.caption: Type ID
type_id.description: The normalized type identifier of the Windows resource object accessed.

0.caption: Unknown
0.description: The resource object type is unknown.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The resource object type is not mapped. See the type attribute, which may contain a data source specific value.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The Windows provided handle identifier for the resource object

win/win_resource.caption: Windows Resource
win/win_resource.description: The Windows resource object describes a resource object managed by Windows, such as mutant or timer.
win/win_resource.name: win_resource

cmd_line.caption: Command Line
cmd_line.description: The full command line used to launch the service.

labels.caption: Labels
labels.description: The list of labels associated with the service.

load_order_group.caption: Load Order Group
load_order_group.description: The name of the load ordering group of which this service is a member.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The unique name of the service.

service_category.caption: Service Category
service_category.description: The service category, normalized to the caption of the service_category_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

service_category_id.caption: Service Category ID
service_category_id.description: The normalized identifier of the service category.

1.caption: Kernel Mode
1.description: A kernel mode driver.

2.caption: User Mode
2.description: A user mode service.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The service category is not mapped. See the service_category attribute, which contains an event source specific value.

service_dependencies.caption: Service Dependencies
service_dependencies.description: The names of other services upon which this service has a dependency.

service_error_control.caption: Service Error Control
service_error_control.description: The service error control, normalized to the caption of the service_error_control_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

service_error_control_id.caption: Service Error Control ID
service_error_control_id.description: The normalized identifier of the service error control.

0.caption: Unknown
0.description: The service error control is unknown.

1.caption: Ignore
1.description: The startup program ignores the error and continues the startup operation.

2.caption: Normal
2.description: The startup program logs the error in the event log but continues the startup operation.

3.caption: Severe
3.description: The startup program logs the error in the event log. If the last-known-good configuration is being started, the startup operation continues. Otherwise, the system is restarted with the last-known-good configuration.

4.caption: Critical
4.description: The startup program logs the error in the event log, if possible. If the last-known-good configuration is being started, the startup operation fails. Otherwise, the system is restarted with the last-known good configuration.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The service error control is not mapped. See the service_error_control attribute, which contains an event source specific value.

service_start_name.caption: Service Start Name
service_start_name.description: For a user mode service, this attribute represents the name of the account under which the service is run. For a kernel mode driver, this attribute represents the object name used to load the driver.

service_start_type.caption: Service Start Type
service_start_type.description: The service start type, normalized to the caption of the service_start_type_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

service_start_type_id.caption: Service Start Type ID
service_start_type_id.description: The normalized identifier of the service start type.

0.caption: Unknown
0.description: The service start type is unknown.

1.caption: Boot
1.description: A kernel mode driver loaded at boot.

2.caption: System
2.description: A kernel mode driver loaded during system startup.

3.caption: Auto
3.description: A user mode service started automatically during system startup.

4.caption: Demand
4.description: A user mode service started on demand when a process calls StartService.

5.caption: Disabled
5.description: A driver or service that cannot be started.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The service start type is not mapped. See the service_start_type attribute, which contains an event source specific value.

service_type.caption: Service Type
service_type.description: The service type, normalized to the caption of the service_type_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

service_type_id.caption: Service Type ID
service_type_id.description: The normalized identifier of the service type.

1.caption: Kernel Driver
1.description: A kernel mode driver.

2.caption: File System Driver
2.description: A kernel mode file system minifilter.

3.caption: Own Process
3.description: A user mode service that runs in its own process.

4.caption: Share Process
4.description: A user mode service that shares a process with other services.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The service type is not mapped. See the service_type attribute, which contains an event source specific value.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The unique identifier of the service.

win/win_service.caption: Windows Service
win/win_service.description: The Windows Service object describes a Windows service.
win/win_service.name: win_service

datetime_t.caption: Datetime
datetime_t.description: The Internet Date/Time format as defined in RFC-3339. For example 1985-04-12T23:20:50.52Z.

file_hash_t.caption: Hash
file_hash_t.description: Hash. A unique value that corresponds to the content of the file, image, ja3_hash or hassh found in the schema. For example MD5: 3172ac7e2b55cbb81f04a6e65855a628.

hostname_t.caption: Hostname
hostname_t.description: Unique name assigned to a device connected to a computer network. A domain name in general is an Internet address that can be resolved through the Domain Name System (DNS). For example: r2-d2.example.com.

ip_t.caption: IP Address
ip_t.description: Internet Protocol address (IP address), in either IPv4 or IPv6 format. For example, 192.168.200.24 or 2001:0db8:85a3:0000:0000:8a2e:0370:7334.

json_t.caption: JSON
json_t.description: Embedded JSON value. A value can be a string, or a number, or true or false or null, or an object or an array. These structures can be nested. See www.json.org.

mac_t.caption: MAC Address
mac_t.description: Media Access Control (MAC) address. For example: 18:36:F3:98:4F:9A.

port_t.caption: Port
port_t.description: The TCP/UDP port number. For example: 80 or 22.

resource_uid_t.caption: Resource UID
resource_uid_t.description: Resource unique identifier. For example, S3 Bucket name or EC2 Instance ID.

subnet_t.caption: Subnet
subnet_t.description:
The subnet represented in a CIDR notation, using the format network_address/prefix_length. The network_address can be in either IPv4 or IPv6 format. The prefix length indicates the number of bits used for the network portion, and the remaining bits are available for host addresses within that subnet.
For example:
  • 192.168.1.0/24
  • 2001:0db8:85a3:0000::/64

timestamp_t.caption: Timestamp
timestamp_t.description: The timestamp format is the number of milliseconds since the Epoch 01/01/1970 00:00:00 UTC. For example 1618524549901.

url_t.caption: URL String
url_t.description: Uniform Resource Locator (URL) string. For example: http://www.example.com/download/trouble.exe.
